topic: Musk offered to buy her a horse for erotic massage: Flight attendant's friend
content: In a declaration, the friend of the flight attendant who has accused Elon Musk of sexually harassing her said that he called her "for a full body massage" and exposed his genitals to her on a flight in 2016. She said he rubbed her leg and "offered to buy her a horse" if she provided him with an erotic massage.

topic: Pichai, Aryabhatta have bigger fans than stars & actors put together: R Madhavan
content: Actor R Madhavan, who's attending the 75th Cannes Film Festival, on Thursday said, "From Aryabhatta to Sundar Pichai, we've such extraordinary stories as far as science and technology is concerned." He added, "We are not making movies about these people...They have bigger fans than stars and actors put together." Madhavan is making his directorial debut with 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'.

topic: Politically motivated: Musk on report claiming he sexually harassed a flight attendant
content: Responding to a report claiming he sexually harassed a flight attendant in 2016, Tesla CEO Elon Musk called the story a "politically motivated hit piece". When asked for a comment on the accusations, he said, "If I were inclined to engage in sexual harassment, this is unlikely to be the first time in my...30-year career that it comes to light."

topic: Sexual harassment story meant to interfere with Twitter acquisition: Musk
content: After a report claimed Tesla CEO Elon Musk allegedly sexually harassed a flight attendant employed by SpaceX in 2016, he said that the story was meant to "interfere with the Twitter acquisition". Responding to a follower who asked if he responded to the writers of the story, Musk replied, "The story was written before they even talked to me."

topic: What is Twitter's new 'crisis misinformation' policy?
content: Designed to tackle "situations of armed conflict, public health emergencies, and large-scale natural disasters," the policy ​will help hide tweets that share false information during such situations. While Twitter said it would rely on various credible sources to check if a tweet is misleading, it will also prioritise adding warning notices to viral tweets and tweets from high-profile accounts.

topic: Describe any scars, tattoos not known: Musk on claims of 'exposing genitals' to air hostess
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to respond to allegations that he allegedly exposed his genitals to a flight attendant in 2016. He tweeted, "I've a challenge to this liar who claims their friend saw me "exposed"...describe just one thing, anything...(scars, tattoos) that isn’t known by the public. She won't be able to do so, because it never happened."

topic: Brazil's Bolsonaro meets Elon Musk, calls his $44 bn Twitter bid a 'breath of hope'
content: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro met the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk in Brazil on Friday. Bolsonaro hailed Musk's $44 billion bid to acquire Twitter and said, "For us here it was like a breath of hope." They also talked about connectivity, investments, innovation and the use of technology to reinforce protection of the Amazon rainforest, Bolsonaro tweeted.

topic: World's 2nd richest man Bezos shares magazine cover he framed as a 'reminder'
content: The world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos took to Twitter to share an old magazine cover featuring him, and said, "I have this old 2006 BusinessWeek framed as a reminder." The magazine's cover featuring Bezos was titled, "Amazon's risky bet". Bezos tweeted, "The 'risky bet' that Wall Street disliked was AWS, which generated revenue of more than $62 billion last year."

topic: Can finally use 'Elongate' as scandal name: Musk amid sexual misconduct claims
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "Finally, we get to use Elongate as scandal name. It's kinda perfect." He quote-tweeted his own tweet from last year where he had suggested calling any scandal about him 'Elongate'. This comes after a report claimed that he allegedly sexually harassed a SpaceX flight attendant in 2016. Musk has called the claims "utterly untrue".

topic: ₹7.4 crore stolen from payment gateway Razorpay using 'failed transactions'
content: Hackers and fraudsters have stolen ₹7.38 crore by tampering with the authorisation process of 831 transactions on the payment gateway Razorpay, the company said in a police complaint. The company conducted an internal investigation after its authorisation and authentication partner Fiserv said the transactions had failed. The transactions had taken place from March 6 to May 13 this year.

topic: Attacks on me should be seen via political lens: Musk after sexual misconduct claims
content: Tesla CEO on Friday tweeted, "Attacks against me should be viewed through a political lens...this is their standard (despicable) playbook...But nothing will deter me from fighting for a good future and your right to free speech." Musk's tweet comes after a report claimed that he allegedly sexually harassed a flight attendant, who worked for SpaceX's corporate jet in 2016.

topic: Meta asks staff to not discuss abortion on internal chat due to 'increased risk'
content: A Meta executive asked employees to refrain from discussing abortion on Workplace, an internal social media platform, citing it as "an increased risk", as per a report. The top Meta executive also said abortion was "the most divisive and reported topic" by employees on Workplace. This comes after the US Supreme Court draft leak proposed abolishing abortion rights nationwide.

topic: Union IT Minister successfully tests 5G call at IIT Madras; shares video
content: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Thursday successfully tested 5G audio and video call at IIT Madras. "Aatmanirbhar 5G...The entire end-to-end network is designed and developed in India," the minister tweeted as he shared a video of the 5G call. The IIT Madras-led 5G testbed, built at a cost of ₹220 crore, was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday.

topic: Musk's deal moving forward as planned, not on 'hold': Twitter executives tell staff
content: Twitter executives told their staff that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's acquisition offer is moving forward as planned and that there is "no such thing as a deal being on hold," as per the employees. While Musk had earlier suggested he might seek a lower price for the deal, executives said they won't renegotiate the agreed-upon price of $54.20 per share.

topic: Musk shares meme, says 'Tesla on my mind 24/7' amid concerns about Twitter distraction
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday tweeted a meme and wrote, "Tesla is on my mind 24/7" amid concerns that he was getting distracted by the Twitter acquisition deal. Sharing the meme, he wrote, "So may seem like below, but not true. To be clear, I'm spending less than 5% (but actually) of my time on the Twitter acquisition."

topic: She's a far-left actor: Musk on friend of air hostess who accused him of sexual harassment
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the friend of the flight attendant who has accused him of sexual harassment "is a far-left activist/actress in LA with a major political axe to grind." In a report, the flight attendant's friend accused Musk of exposing himself and offering to buy a horse for her friend in exchange for an erotic massage in 2016.

topic: TikTok tests letting users play games on app in Vietnam: Report
content: TikTok has been conducting tests allowing users to play games on the app in Vietnam, Reuters reported. It could expand the gaming feature to more regions in Southeast Asia as early as third quarter. TikTok said it has tested bringing HTML5 games to its app through tie-ups with third-party game developers and studios, but didn't mention its plans for Vietnam.

topic: Google deceptively collects data in Incognito mode: US lawsuit
content: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton filed an amended privacy lawsuit against Google accusing it of collecting data of users who think they can be anonymous if they use the Incognito mode. "In reality, Google deceptively collects an array of personal data even when a user has engaged Incognito mode," the suit alleges. "We...will vigorously defend ourselves," Google has said.

topic: China opposes Canada's plans to ban Huawei, ZTE from 5G network
content: China has said it is opposed to Canada's plans to ban the use of 5G equipment from China's Huawei and ZTE to protect national security. China said it will take all necessary measures to "safeguard the legitimate interests of Chinese firms". China's embassy in Canada said the alleged security concerns were a "pretext for political manipulation".

topic: Meta planning to launch crypto-supported payments platform: Filings
content: Meta is planning to launch a payments platform with support for cryptocurrency, trademark filings revealed. Meta filed five applications in the US for a new platform called 'Meta Pay'. The applications seek licenses to operate as an "online social networking service" for investors allowing financial trades and exchange of digital currency, virtual currency and cryptocurrency, among other things.

topic: Haven't worked on Dogecoin for 7.5 yrs, & won't ever again: Co-creator
content: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus took to Twitter to clarify that he doesn't work on Dogecoin anymore, saying, "I haven't for 7.5 years, and I won't ever again." "One goal here is just to help people see the cryptocurrency market for what it actually is. Doing so in an amusing way is a bonus," he added.

topic: Twitter to label false tweets on Ukraine, disable likes, retweets
content: Twitter has announced that it will start putting misleading and false posts regarding the conflict in Ukraine behind a warning notice and limit their spread. The platform will not amplify or recommend such tweets and likes, retweets and shares will be disabled. It'll prioritise adding labels to misleading tweets from high-profile accounts such as verified users or official government profiles.

topic: Indore's drone startup sprays fertiliser over 4,000 acres of land
content: Drone startup SkyLane Dronetech has sprayed fertiliser over 4,000 acres of agricultural land using a drone. "We have sprayed fertilisers in...Khargone, Raisen, Shajapur, Rajgarh, Guna and Gwalior districts with...a drone to do a business of ₹12.5 lakh,'' SkyLane CEO Prayas Saxena said. The Indore-based startup received ₹2 crore loan from the central government's Agriculture Infrastructure Fund.

topic: Samsung leader excused from trial hearing ahead of Biden's plant visit
content: Samsung leader Jay Y Lee has been excused from attending an accounting fraud trial hearing on Friday, ahead of US President Joe Biden's tour of a Samsung plant in South Korea. Lee is expected to accompany Biden during his tour of the plant in Pyeongtaek. The plant is expected to be Biden's first stop on his trip to South Korea.

topic: New York probes social media platforms Buffalo shooting suspect used
content: Social media platforms believed to be used by Buffalo mass shooting suspect are being investigated by New York state authorities. The probe will focus on platforms like Amazon-owned Twitch, Discord, online message boards 4chan and 8chan and other platforms "the shooter used to amplify his attack". Twitch had detected the shooter's live stream within two minutes of the violence beginning.

topic: Apple delays plan requiring employees to come to office 3 days a week
content: Apple has delayed its plan that required its employees to come to the office three days a week, according to a memo seen by Bloomberg. Apple said that the requirement is being delayed "for the time being", without providing a new date. The technology company still requires its employees to come to the office two days a week.

topic: Musk responds after Twitter employee says 'he is special needs, he has Asperger's'
content: Elon Musk has responded after a journalist shared a video in which a Twitter employee calls the Tesla CEO "special needs" and says that he has Asperger's. "Twitter exec trashing free speech & mocking people with Asperger's," Musk wrote. "I can't even take what Musk says seriously," the employee can be heard saying in the video.

topic: Follow rules or leave India: Government to VPN providers
content: VPN service providers that are not ready to comply with the new guidelines have the only option to exit from India, MoS for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said. "If you don't have the logs, start maintaining the logs. If you are a VPN that wants to hide...then frankly you have no other opportunity but to pull out," he said.

topic: Elon Musk loses $12 billion in a day after he tweets on politics, criticises ESG
content: Elon Musk lost $12 billion in a day after he took to Twitter to announce his political switch from Democrat to Republican and criticised Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG). Musk remains the world's richest person, with a fortune of around $210 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk called Democrats the party of division and hate.

topic: 19-yr-old who tracks Musk's jet claims he has found Zuckerberg's new aircraft
content: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old who tracks Elon Musk's jet, on Wednesday tweeted, "We've found Mark Zuckerberg's jet N68885. Numerous trips point it being his." Sweeney shared a picture of the aircraft. In February, Sweeney began tracking and sharing updates on what he said was Zuckerberg's private jet. In April, he said the aircraft was no longer being used by Zuckerberg.

topic: Russia to legalise crypto as means of payment 'sooner or later'
content: Russia's Industry and Trade Minister Denis Manturov has said the country will be legalising cryptocurrency as a means of payment "sooner or later". "The question is, when this happens, how it will be regulated, now that the central bank and government are actively working on it," he added. Russia has plans to issue its own digital rouble.

topic: We intend to close the transaction and enforce Musk merger agreement: Twitter board
content: Twitter Inc's board said it plans to enforce its $44 billion agreement to be bought by Elon Musk, saying the transaction is in the best interest of all shareholders. "We intend to close the transaction," the board said on Tuesday in a statement to Bloomberg News. The proposed takeover includes a $1 billion breakup fee for each party.

topic: Is this legit: Musk on Twitter engineer's 'free speech' leaked recording
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reacted to the leaked recording of a top Twitter engineer saying the platform does not believe in free speech, saying, "Is this legit?" The video also showed Siru Murugesan saying Twitter employees "hated" Musk's $44 billion takeover bid. Responding to Musk, American columnist Benny Johnson claimed Twitter has acknowledged that the video is authentic.

topic: I have the honour of having the most-liked tweet of any living human: Musk
content: Elon Musk said, "I have the honour of having the most-liked tweet of any living human. Thank you everyone for liking my tweet." Musk said that his tweet, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in," has over 4.8 million likes. Notably, the tweet announcing actor Chadwick Boseman's death is the most-liked ever, with over 7.1 million likes.

topic: I am leaving Twitter, it's not because of Elon: Twitter VP of Product Management
content: Ilya Brown, one of Twitter's latest three senior executives to leave Twitter, tweeted, "Yes, I'm leaving Twitter. No, it is not because of Elon or uncertainty inside the company." Ilya Brown, Twitter's Vice President of Product Management, said, "It has been an amazing six years and I've loved every second of it." Ilya added, "I will forever love this place."

topic: I can no longer support Democrats, will vote Republican: Elon Musk
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that while he voted for Democrats in the past, he will now vote for Republicans. "In the past I voted Democrat, because they were (mostly) the kindness party. But they have become the party of division & hate, so I can no longer support them and will vote Republican," he tweeted.

topic: Top engineer who quit Apple over return-to-office policy joins Google: Report
content: Ian Goodfellow, who quit as Apple's Director of Machine Learning over the company's return-to-office policy, is joining Google parent Alphabet's AI unit DeepMind, Bloomberg reported. He worked in different capacities for Google since 2013, before joining Apple in 2019. He's best known for inventing Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), a class of machine learning frameworks.

topic: Tesla to show sneak preview of humanoid Tesla Bot on AI Day in Aug
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has confirmed in a tweet that the firm will be showing a sneak preview of its humanoid Tesla Bot in August. The preview will be shown on August 19, when Tesla is holding its second AI Day. "The purpose of AI Day is to convince great AI/software/chip talent to join Tesla," Musk had tweeted earlier.

topic: Researcher shows way Teslas could be unlocked using vulnerability
content: NCC Group researcher Sultan Qasim Khan has demonstrated the way he unlocked a Tesla using a vulnerability he said Tesla has been informed about. He unlocked a 2020 Tesla Model 3 using a vulnerability in the BLE technology on which the entry system relies. He added any smart locks using BLE technology could be unlocked in the same way.

topic: Ridiculous: Cathie Wood on Tesla being cut from S&P 500 ESG Index
content: Ark Invest's Cathie Wood in response to Tesla being cut from the S&P 500 ESG Index, said, "Ridiculous. Not worthy of any other response." Responding to Wood, Musk wrote, "Yup. A clear case of wacktivism." "What I love most about wacktivists is their incredible sense of humour," he wrote in another tweet later.

topic: Getty Images to launch NFTs derived from its library of 465 mn images
content: Getty Images has entered into an agreement with Candy Digital to develop a diverse portfolio of NFT products and collections. The NFTs will be derived from the platform's library of "more than 465 million images", including over 135 million analogue images from Getty Images' photographic archive. Many of the analogue archival photographs have never been seen before by the public.

topic: Apple stops storing card information for customers in India
content: Apple has decided to stop storing credit and debit card information for Indian customers making payments for its services. The decision was made in light of the Reserve Bank of India's new card storage guidelines which will be effective shortly. Apple said the unified payments interface or net banking can be used by customers for these payments to avoid interruptions.

topic: Tencent's profit halves in Q1 2022, its worst performance since 2004
content: China's Tencent said its profit had halved YoY and it recorded no revenue growth in Q1 2022, its worst performance since 2004. Tencent's revenue in Q1 2022 was ¥135.5 billion (₹1,55,959 crore) as compared with ¥135.3 billion (₹1,55,728 crore) in Q1 2021. This comes after China launched a regulatory crackdown last year to reign in influence of large internet firms.

topic: The journey has been far from smooth: Bezos on 25 yrs of Amazon's IPO
content: Amazon's Jeff Bezos shared a throwback picture of himself on social media on the occasion of 25 years of Amazon's IPO, saying the journey has been far from smooth. He also specified that the IPO share price was $1.50 on Twitter. "Lots of risk-taking, lots of invention, lots of mistakes, so much we still have to do better," he added.

topic: Trump's social media firm may raise $50 mn before SPAC deal closes
content: Former US President Donald Trump's social media venture has said it may raise up to $50 million through convertible notes before it merges with a blank-check acquisition firm, filings revealed. TMTG raised $38.2 million through issuance of convertible promissory notes, as of March 31. TMTG is set to receive $1.25 billion in funding once it merges with Digital World Acquisition.

topic: Tesla cut from S&P 500 ESG Index, Musk says 'ESG is a scam'
content: The S&P 500 removed Tesla from its ESG Index as part of an annual update citing issues including claims of racial discrimination and poor working conditions at Tesla. Responding to the exclusion, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "ESG is a scam. It has been weaponised by phoney social justice warriors." "S&P Global Ratings has lost their integrity," he added.

topic: Google's Russian subsidiary to file for bankruptcy after account seizure
content: Google's Russian subsidiary plans to file for bankruptcy after its bank account was seized by authorities, a Google spokesperson said on Wednesday. "Russian authorities' seizure of Google Russia's bank account has made it untenable for our Russia office to function," the spokesperson said. This is the first time that Google said its bank account as a whole has been seized.

topic: No plans to block YouTube or cut ourselves off from internet: Russia
content: Russia's minister of communications Maksut Shadayev said Russia is not planning to shut YouTube in the country. He said that such a move would likely see Russian users suffer and should therefore be avoided. He added Russia doesn't want to cut itself off from global internet infrastructure, saying, "We think that Russia should remain a part of the global network."

topic: Delhi govt likely to flag off 100 electric buses next week: Report
content: The Delhi government will likely flag off nearly 100 electric buses next week, media reports cited officials as saying. The government has received a batch of over 100 electric buses. While the ones planned to be flagged off next week are fully integrated, the remaining buses are still being integrated. There are two e-bus depots to house these buses.

topic: Tesla vehicle crash that killed three under probe in US
content: The US NHTSA is investigating a crash involving a Tesla that may have been operating in Autopilot during a crash that killed three people. The vehicle had hit a curb and slammed into construction equipment. This is one of 35 crashes under investigation by NHTSA involving Tesla vehicles in which its Autopilot was suspected of being used since 2016.

topic: Netflix lays off 150 employees citing slowing revenue growth
content: Netflix has announced that it has laid off around 150 employees, mostly in the US, as it faces slowing revenue growth. "These changes are primarily driven by business needs rather than individual performance, which makes them especially tough," the firm said. The reductions come less than a month after Netflix reported its first subscriber loss in a decade.

topic: You call yourself sh*tposter, maybe you're wiseposter: Bezos to DOGE co-creator
content: Amazon's Jeff Bezos in response to a tweet by Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus said, "Seen you refer to yourself as...sh*tposter but maybe you're mostly just a wiseposter." Markus had tweeted about how Democrats and Republicans could pull more people to their side. Markus thanked Bezos and said he's addicted to dopamine and his tweets are just random thoughts he has.

topic: 3 more top Twitter employees leave ahead of Elon Musk's takeover
content: Twitter lost three more senior employees, including two vice presidents, ahead of Elon Musk's takeover. Ilya Brown, a VP of product management; Katrina Lane, VP of Twitter Service; and Max Schmeiser, head of data science, are all leaving the company, a Twitter spokesperson confirmed. Earlier, Twitter Chief Executive Officer Parag Agrawal fired two top executives.

topic: Twitter deal can't move forward until CEO shows proof of spam accounts data: Musk
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday said the Twitter deal cannot move forward until CEO Parag Agrawal shows proof of spam accounts data. Musk wrote, "20% fake/spam accounts, while 4 times what Twitter claims...My offer was based on Twitter’s SEC filings being accurate...Twitter's CEO publicly refused to show proof of less than 5%. This deal cannot move forward until he does."

topic: Influencer raises ₹1.8 cr for Uber driver who helped her after she was robbed in US
content: A social media influencer raised over $2,40,000 (approximately ₹1.8 crore) via crowdfunding for an Uber driver after he helped her when she got robbed in California. The driver had helped her find her phone and credit card which were robbed during Coachella. The driver had revealed to her that his daughter was diagnosed with cancer, following which she started crowdfunding.

topic: We suspend over half a million spam accounts every day: Twitter CEO
content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal shared an extensive Twitter thread on spam accounts amid its acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk being put on hold. Parag tweeted, "We suspend over half a million spam accounts every day, usually before any of you even see them on Twitter. We...lock millions of accounts each week that we suspect may be spam."

topic: India should be ready to launch 6G services in 10 years: PM Modi
content: PM Narendra Modi has said that India should be ready to launch 6G services in the next 10 years, adding that a task force has already started work on it. The 5G technology will contribute $450 billion to India's economy in the next decade and a half, PM added. He said India is today the "world's biggest mobile manufacturing hub."

topic: Microsoft to 'nearly double' salaries to retain employees, raises stock option
content: Microsoft announced that it will "nearly double" its budget for merit-based employee pay increases in order to retain its employees. The company said it will also increase its annual stock options by 25%. In an email to Microsoft employees, CEO Satya Nadella wrote, "Because of the amazing work you do...we're making long-term investments in each of you."

topic: Twitter doesn't believe in free speech: Senior engineer in leaked recording
content: A senior engineer at Twitter has said the company "doesn't believe in free speech" and the employees "hated" Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s $44 billion takeover bid. An American activist group Project Veritas released a recording of Siru Murugesan's remarks. Murugesan said Twitter's office politics were quite left-leaning and the staff had to change their original views to adjust to it.

topic: Bitcoin has no future as a payments network: FTX's billionaire CEO
content: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX's 30-year-old billionaire CEO, Sam Bankman-Fried, has said that Bitcoin has no future as a payments network, Financial Times reported. The billionaire also criticised the digital currency for its inefficiency and high environmental costs. Later in a tweet, he clarified, "To be clear, I also said that it does have potential as a store of value."

topic: Twitter CEO posts long thread on spam accounts, Musk replies with poop emoji
content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Monday tweeted a long thread on spam accounts amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s proposed acquisition being put on hold over fake accounts data. Speaking about Musk’s plan to identify bots, Parag said “We don't believe that this specific estimation can be performed externally”. In reply to this, Musk tweeted a poop emoji.

topic: We censor the right and not the left: Twitter's senior engineer in a leaked recording
content: In a leaked video recording, a senior engineer at Twitter remarked, “We censor the right and not the left”. Speaking about how differently the company functions from Tesla CEO Elon Musk's firms, Siru Murugesan said, "We're all commie…He's a capitalist and we weren't really operating as capitalists, more like very socialist.” He claimed employees tried to revolt against Musk's takeover.

topic: PM inaugurates IIT Madras-led India's first 5G testbed costing ₹220 crore
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated India's first 5G testbed developed indigenously in a collaborative project by eight institutes led by IIT Madras. The 5G testbed will enable startups and industry players to test and validate their products locally and reduce dependence on foreign facilities. It has been set up at a cost of around ₹220 crore.

topic: They want to muddy the topic: Jeff Bezos on US govt criticising his recent tweets
content: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos tweeted, "They understandably want to muddy the topic," on the White House's statement about his tweets opposing taxing the rich corporations to tame inflation. It accused Bezos of opposing an "economic agenda for the middle class that cuts some of the biggest costs families face". Earlier, Bezos accused US President Joe Biden of "misdirection" over inflation.

topic: Steve Jobs wanted original iPhone to have no SIM card: iPod's creator
content: Apple's iPod creator Tony Fadell revealed that Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs wanted the first iPhone with no SIM card slot and wanted it to work on CDMA networks. "We don't want another hole in it (iPhone)," Jobs was quoted as saying by Fadell. "We had to give him data...to tell him that we need a SIM card slot," added Fadell.

topic: Ex-eBay workers plead guilty to harassing couple with spiders, funeral wreaths
content: As many as six former employees at eBay have pleaded guilty to harassing a couple, who ran an online newsletter and published several articles critiquing eBay in the US. They sent them live cockroaches, spiders, funeral wreaths, a bloodied pig mask and pornography. The six of them were charged in June 2020 while former CEO Devin Wenig was also sued.

topic: Good move: Musk on Netflix telling staff 'If you don't like our content, you can quit'
content: Elon Musk tweeted, "Good move by Netflix", in response to an article about Netflix asking its employees to quit if they don't like the company's content. Netflix recently updated its culture guidelines to add an "Artistic Expression" section. Under it, Netflix says, "If you'd find it hard to support our content breadth...Netflix may not be the best place for you."

topic: B'luru police tracks over 2,500 IP addresses to arrest man who stole a car via OLX ad
content: The Bengaluru police arrested a man three months after he allegedly stole an SUV on the pretext of taking it for a test drive. He stole the SUV on January 30, from an engineer who had posted an ad about it on OLX. While the accused used a stolen phone, the police tracked him after verifying over 2,500 IP addresses.

topic: US-based customers use Tesla cars to mine $800/month in crypto
content: Tesla owners are using their cars as a power source to mine cryptocurrency. San Francisco-based Siraj Raval hacked his Model 3's onboard internal firmware to mine up to $800 worth of cryptocurrency every month. Wisconsin-based Chris Allessi connected a power inverter and a bitcoin miner to his Model S' battery to mine bitcoin and monero.

topic: SEBI proposes banning celebrities from promoting crypto products
content: SEBI has recommended that no prominent public figures, including celebrities and sportspersons, should endorse crypto products. It added that firms advertising cryptos and digital assets should put up disclosures listing out the possible law violations. This comes after the Advertising Standards Council of India (ASCI) in February said crypto ads must carry a prominent and unmissable disclaimer.

topic: Tesla recalls 1,07,293 China-made vehicles due to overheating
content: Tesla is recalling 1,07,293 China-made Model 3 and Model Y vehicles due to overheating that may cause the centre touchscreen display to malfunction, China's market regulatory agency said on Monday. As per the State Administration for Market Regulation, the overheating could also lead to windshield settings and gear displays malfunctions. Last week, Tesla recalled 1,30,000 vehicles in the US.

topic: Trump to wait for 6 hours before reposting Truth Social content
content: Ex-US President Donald Trump is obligated to first post to new social network Truth Social and can't publish it on another social media site for six hours, as per a regulatory filing. However, he's still free to post from personal account about political messaging on any platform at any time. Recently, Elon Musk said he'd reverse Trump's ban on Twitter.

topic: Non-profit behind collapsed Terra ecosystem to compensate users
content: The Luna Foundation Guard (LFG), a non-profit organisation that supports the Terra ecosystem, on Monday announced that it will compensate the remaining users of TerraUSD/UST, after the stablecoin collapsed last week. "We're still debating through various distribution methods," the LFG tweeted. It spent millions of dollars worth of crypto trying to defend UST's dollar peg last week, it added.

topic: Uber launches robot-assisted food delivery service in 2 US cities
content: Uber on Monday said it has launched pilot food delivery services with autonomous vehicles in two cities in US' California. It announced one food delivery service using autonomous cars and a separate pilot using sidewalk robots. Both services are available to users in Santa Monica and West Hollywood and can be opted out of.

topic: Elon Musk considers visit to Indonesia over possible investments
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is considering a visit to Indonesia to explore investment opportunities. As per Indonesian President Joko Widodo's office, Musk said to Widodo, "Hopefully in November...thank you for the invitation," after the two met in Texas on Saturday. Indonesia, which has some of the largest nickel deposits, has been in talks with Musk's team over electric vehicles development.

topic: Tesla to hold second artificial intelligence day on Aug 19: Musk
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has announced that the firm will be hosting its second artificial intelligence day on August 19. "The purpose of AI Day is to convince great AI/software/chip talent to join Tesla," he tweeted. The company held its first AI Day in August last year and a Battery Day in September 2020.

topic: WhatsApp Pay to display user's legal name to avoid UPI frauds
content: WhatsApp will now display users' legal name for every transaction they make on WhatsApp Pay to mitigate fraud on UPI payments system. The company said the name associated with a user's bank account, identified using their phone number on WhatsApp, is the name that will be shared. WhatsApp users have the choice to pick any name on the app.

topic: Motorists to get traffic e-challans on WhatsApp: Cyberabad Police
content: Cyberabad Police have informed that motorists who have violated traffic rules will soon be getting traffic e-challans on their WhatsApp numbers. Taking to Twitter, Cyberabad Police said, "Motorists violating traffic rules will soon be sent an e-challan with a photo of the violation to their WhatsApp [numbers]." "Preparations are underway to bring this policy within a week," Cyberabad Police added.

topic: Expect more change for better: Twitter CEO after firing 2 top executives
content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Saturday shared a detailed thread about the changes in the company after two top executives were fired a day before. Parag wrote, "So what can you expect from me going forward? I'm still focused on doing the job, and that includes making hard decisions as needed...And you can expect more change for the better."

topic: What are stablecoins, the product that led to a massive selloff in crypto market?
content: Stablecoin is a utility token built upon another coin's blockchain to create a cryptocurrency that's non-volatile, by maintaining its value at $1. However, stablecoin TerraUSD/'UST' collapsed from $1 to as low as 13 cents this week. Terra's token LUNA, meant to stabilise UST prices, fell 100% to a fraction of a cent, causing a massive selloff in crypto market.

topic: Won't use Musk's deal to avoid making important decisions: Twitter CEO
content: After two top executives were fired on Friday, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal said he won't use the acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk "as an excuse to avoid making important decisions" for Twitter. He wrote, "While I expect the deal to close, we need to be prepared for all scenarios…Our industry is in a very challenging macro environment...right now."

topic: No one at Twitter working just to keep lights on: CEO on changes in company
content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal in a post remarked that "no one at Twitter is working just to keep the lights on." The post which came after two top executives were fired, further read, "Some have been asking why a "lame-duck" CEO would make these changes if we're getting acquired anyway…Regardless of the company's future ownership, we're...improving Twitter as a product."

topic: Vir Das compares his mom's Lajpat Nagar shopping to Elon Musk buying Twitter
content: Comedian Vir Das compared his mother's Lajpat Nagar shopping to Elon Musk buying Twitter, and wrote, "Musk is my mom with rockets." Das said his mother "would go into one shop, like something...pretend not to like it too much...and drive the price down". "Other shopkeepers...would offer her better deals," Das said, adding that "she'd come back to the same shop".

topic: May have to buy Twitter now: Snoop Dogg after Musk's deal put on hold
content: Rapper Snoop Dogg on Friday said that he "may have to buy Twitter now". Snoop Dogg’s tweet came after Tesla CEO Elon Musk's takeover bid was temporarily put on hold over fake account data. Snoop Dogg further stated rules for the company which included replacing the board of directors, giving everyone a verified account and putting free internet on planes.

topic: How do I edit a typo on Twitter? Oh right: Bezos on his incorrect tweet
content: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos took to Twitter to remark about the absence of an edit button on the platform in an apparent reference. Responding to an earlier tweet wherein he had made an error, Bezos wrote, "Help me out. How do I edit a typo on Twitter? Oh right..." Earlier in April, Twitter confirmed it's working on an edit button.

topic: Started Dell with just $1,000 in 1984, made $101 bn in revenue in 2021: CEO
content: Michael Dell, CEO of Dell Technologies, took to LinkedIn to share a memory of how he started the company. He wrote, "A fun memory from 34 years ago. I started Dell Technologies in 1984 with $1,000 in my...university...dorm room." He added that by 1987, Dell had posted $159 million in revenue and in 2021 its revenue grew to $101 billion.

topic: Tesla shares gain after Elon Musk puts $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
content: Shares of Tesla surged 4% on Friday after its CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk said he has temporarily put the $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter on hold. Tesla shares have lost about 25% of their value since Musk disclosed a stake in Twitter on April 4. Meanwhile, Twitter stock plunged 10% after Musk's announcement on Friday.

topic: CoinSwitch delists LUNA as it crashes 100%, CEO says 'meltdown is rapid'
content: CoinSwitch Kuber CEO Ashish Singhal on Friday tweeted that the crypto exchange is delisting Terra's LUNA crypto token after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. "The last few days have been tough for all of us...The meltdown of the Terra ecosystem and LUNA have been rapid and devastating," Singhal said, noting that it is "a tough decision".

topic: Blockchain behind collapsed UST, LUNA tokens resumes activity after 9-hour halt
content: The blockchain behind stablecoin TerraUSD, or UST, and its affiliated LUNA token has resumed activity after a nine-hour halt on Friday. The Terra blockchain had stopped processing new transactions for the second time in less than a day after UST and LUNA collapsed. Several crypto exchanges, including WazirX, CoinDCX and CoinSwitch Kuber, delisted LUNA from their platforms on Friday.

topic: Still committed to acquisition: Musk after putting $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
content: Elon Musk tweeted he's "still committed to acquisition" after he put on hold the $44 billion deal to take Twitter private. Musk has temporarily put the deal on hold while he awaits data supporting Twitter's claim that spam accounts comprise less than 5% of users. Twitter shares fell to their lowest level since Musk disclosed his stake after the announcement.

topic: Netflix not the best place for you if you can't support our content: Netflix to staff
content: Netflix has sent a memo telling its employees that they might have to work on shows that they "perceive to be harmful", as it refuses to "censor specific artists or voices". It added, "We program for a diversity of audiences and tastes...If you'd find it hard to support our content breadth, Netflix may not be the best place for you."

topic: Musk announces 'random sampling' of 100 Twitter followers after deal put on hold
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said his team will do a random sampling of 100 followers on Twitter after the acquisition deal was put on hold over fake account data. Replying to a Twitter user, Musk said he picked 100 as the sample size number because that is what Twitter uses to calculate under 5% fake, spam or duplicate accounts.

topic: Algae powers a microprocessor continuously for a year; pic released
content: University of Cambridge researchers used algae to power a microprocessor continuously for a year, and counting, using nothing but ambient light and water. The system contains a type of non-toxic algae 'Synechocystis' that harvests energy from the sun through photosynthesis. The tiny electrical current this generates then interacts with an aluminium electrode and is used to power a microprocessor.

topic: Twitter legal called to complain I violated NDA by revealing bot check sample size: Musk
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter's legal team accused him of violating a non-disclosure agreement by revealing that the sample size for the social media platform's checks on automated users is 100. Musk tweeted, "Twitter legal just called to complain that I violated their NDA by revealing the bot check sample size is 100! This actually happened."

topic: My $2.8 mn is literally worth $1,000: YouTuber KSI after losing millions in LUNA crash
content: YouTuber KSI claimed he lost about $2.8 million after the cryptocurrency LUNA crashed. He revealed he had put $2.8 million in LUNA, but it plummeted to a new valuation of less than $1,000 in a day. Speaking about how previous losses made him depressed and seek therapy, KSI wrote about the recent loss, "But that's ok because I'm not dead."

topic: Musk says 'Twitter users being manipulated in ways they don't realise', Dorsey replies
content: Elon Musk said Twitter users are being manipulated by the algorithm in ways they don't realise. He tweeted, "Very important to fix your Twitter feed: Tap home button, tap stars on upper right and select 'Latest tweets'." Reacting to it, former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey said, "It was designed simply to save you time when you are away from app."

topic: Tesla puts on hold plans to sell electric cars in India over import duties: Report
content: Tesla has reportedly put on hold plans to sell electric cars in India after the company failed to secure lower import taxes. Billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla has abandoned a search for showroom space in the country and reassigned some of its domestic team, Reuters reported citing sources. In 2021, Musk had said that India has the world's highest import duties.

topic: Relied on Twitter's earlier filings: Musk on fake account data
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on being asked by a Twitter user why he didn't think of fake accounts percentage earlier, said, "I relied upon the accuracy of Twitter's public filings." This comes after Musk announced that his Twitter deal was temporarily put on hold. Musk's team will do a random sampling of 100 Twitter followers to check for fake accounts.

topic: Samsung in talks to hike chipmaking prices by up to 20%: Report
content: Samsung Electronics is in talks with its clients about hiking prices for chip manufacturing deals by up to 20% this year, Bloomberg reported. It has completed negotiations with some clients while still in discussions with others. Contract-based chip prices are likely to rise around 15% to 20%, depending upon the level of sophistication.

topic: TikTok sued by family of 10-yr-old US girl who died in viral challenge
content: The family of a 10-year-old US girl who choked herself to death allegedly while participating in TikTok's viral 'blackout challenge', has sued the platform. Nylah Anderson was found unconscious in her bedroom in December 2021. She spent five days in an ICU before succumbing to her injuries. Her family alleges TikTok's algorithm pushed the dare in front of her.

topic: Ex-eBay exec charged with harassing US couple pleads guilty
content: Former director of global resiliency at eBay, David Harville, has pleaded guilty in the US to five conspiracy and stalking counts, becoming the last of seven ex-workers admitting to harassing a US couple who spoke against eBay. The seven people participated in a campaign against the couple that involved sending them disturbing home deliveries like cockroaches and a funeral wreath.

topic: Alibaba lays off 40% of AliExpress Russia staff amid war: Report
content: China's Alibaba has laid off about 40% of AliExpress Russia staff amid the ongoing Ukrainian war, the Nikkei reported. Some of the laid-off staff chose to leave voluntarily and a few relocated. The firm's commercial division was hit the hardest due to the layoffs. AliExpress Russia is a joint venture launched in 2019 by Alibaba and Russian partners.

topic: Apple is testing iPhone models with USB-C ports: Report
content: Apple has been testing iPhones that are equipped with USB-C ports instead of Lightning ports in recent months, Bloomberg reported. It's also working on an adapter that would let future iPhones work with accessories designed for the current Lightning connector. Apple does not plan to make the switch from Lightning to USB-C until 2023 at the earliest.

topic: Meta, Twitter seek to block Texas media law against certain bans
content: Meta, Google, Twitter and other tech firms, represented by their lobbying groups, have filed an emergency request with the US Supreme Court seeking to block a Texas law that prohibits the platforms from banning users based on their political views. It also requires them to publicly disclose how they moderate content. The law was successfully blocked in court last year.

topic: Trump's media firm starts hiring for its upcoming streaming platform
content: Former US President Donald Trump's media venture has posted job openings for two professionals for its upcoming streaming platform TMTG+. It said the platform will offer "entertainment rooted in free speech" and deliver "a wide variety of non-scripted, scripted, and original content". It posted a requirement for a content acquisitional professional "to oversee content licensing and acquisition".

topic: Twitter deal is temporarily on hold, tweets Elon Musk
content: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that his $44 billion deal to take Twitter private is "temporarily on hold". The deal has been put on hold "pending details supporting calculation that spam/fake accounts do indeed represent less than 5% of users", Musk said. Shares of the micro-blogging site fell over 20% in pre-market trading after Musk's tweet.

topic: Motorola announces edge 30 as the world’s thinnest 5G phone
content: Aiming to disrupt India's premium smartphone market, Motorola has announced the launch of edge 30 as the world's thinnest 5G phone with 6.79 mm thickness & 155 gm weight. The smartphone, starting at ₹25,999* offers flagship features like 144Hz 10-bit pOLED display & India's first Snapdragon 778G+. It goes on sale starting May 19 on Flipkart & Reliance Digital stores.

topic: Saudi Aramco dethrones Apple as world's most valuable company
content: World's biggest crude exporter Saudi Aramco has overtaken Apple as the world's most valuable company. The Saudi state-run oil company's market cap rose to $2.43 trillion on Wednesday after its shares surged due to higher oil prices. Meanwhile, Apple's market capitalisation fell to $2.37 trillion after its share price tanked 5.2% on Wednesday.

topic: Over $200 billion wiped off cryptocurrency market in 24 hours
content: More than $200 billion of wealth was wiped out from the cryptocurrency market in just 24 hours amid a massive sell-off, Bloomberg reported on Thursday citing CoinMarketCap data. The crypto plunge was driven by the collapse of the TerraUSD stablecoin. The plunge affected major tokens and Bitcoin plunged by as much as 10% to its lowest level since December 2020.

topic: I'll never be Twitter CEO again: Co-founder Jack Dorsey
content: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey, in response to a tweet saying Elon Musk will eventually ask him to be the CEO, said, "Nah I'll never be CEO again." On being asked if he would like such a prospect, Dorsey said, "Nah. It's time to roll the dice again." He also said no one should be Twitter's CEO ultimately.

topic: 73 of India's 100 unicorns have at least 1 founder from IIT: Report
content: Data shared by analytics firm Tracxn Technologies showed that 73 of India’s 100 unicorns have at least one founder from IITs. Out of these, the founders belong to seven of the 23 IITs, with IIT Delhi in the lead. About 21 unicorns have at least one founder who is an IIT Delhi alumni, followed by IIT Bombay, with 16.

topic: Joe Biden was elected as people wanted less drama: Elon Musk
content: World’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that US President Joe Biden’s "mistake is that he thinks he was elected to transform the country, but actually everyone just wanted less drama." Earlier, Musk had also said that he would reverse Twitter’s ban on former US President Donald Trump and said that the ban was "morally wrong".

topic: Tesla shares dropped by 26% ever since Musk offered to buy Twitter
content: Shares of Tesla have slipped by 26% ever since its CEO and world’s richest person Elon Musk offered to takeover Twitter on April 14. The shares have plunged on the fears that Musk will get distracted with Twitter. Meanwhile, shares of Twitter slipped to $45.23 on Thursday, nearly 20% below Musk’s offer price of $54.20 per share.

topic: Employee fired by Twitter changes bio to 'unemployed'; thanks team members
content: The second top executive who was fired by Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, has changed his Twitter bio to ‘unemployed’. In a now deleted tweet, Bruce Falck, who oversaw revenue, had written, “I'll clarify that I too was fired by (Parag)." Falck later thanked his team in a tweet thread and said he can't wait to see their future work.

topic: WazirX, CoinDCX delist crypto token LUNA after it crashes nearly 100%
content: Indian crypto exchanges WazirX and CoinDCX are delisting crypto token LUNA after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. LUNA crashed after its sister token, TerraUSD or 'UST', a stablecoin that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, lost its peg. CoinDCX said that it has also delisted UST from its app with immediate effect.

topic: Siemens announces exit from Russian market, condemns Ukrainian war
content: German multinational conglomerate Siemens will quit the Russian market due to the war in Ukraine. "We join the international community in condemning the war in Ukraine and are focused on supporting our people and providing humanitarian aid," CEO Roland Busch said. Siemens reportedly employs around 3,000 people in Russia and had earlier decided not to take on new projects there.

topic: US theatre installs IR cameras to catch people filming nude scenes
content: US' Broadway theatre has installed infrared cameras pointed at the audience to see if anyone is trying to use a recording device during nude scenes. This comes after someone posted videos of actor Jesse Williams and co-star Michael Oberholtzer online that were taken during a nude scene from a play. The camera system will be monitored in real-time.

topic: Global crypto regulation body likely in next year: IOSCO Chair
content: The International Organisation of Securities Commissions' (IOSCO) Chair Ashley Alder said global market regulators are likely to launch a joint body within the next year to better co-ordinate cryptocurrency rules. "There's a wall of worry about this (crypto)...at an institutional level," Alder stated. He added that the main concerns are cyber security and a lack of transparency, among others.

topic: HC allows Xiaomi conditional access to seized ₹5,551 cr: Report
content: The Karnataka High Court has declined to reinstate a freeze on ₹5,551 crore belonging to Chinese smartphone-maker Xiaomi, Hindustan Times reported citing Reuters. The funds were seized by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with "illegal outward remittances" but the seizure was stayed after Xiaomi appealed. The Court also allowed Xiaomi to use a bank overdraft facility to make payments.

topic: Most dumb thing: Musk on hydrogen as tool for energy storage
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in an interview dismissed hydrogen's use for energy storage, saying it's "the most dumb thing I could possibly imagine for energy storage". "I really can't emphasise this enough...Hydrogen is a bad choice," he said. He argued that "gigantic tanks" would be needed for storing hydrogen in liquid form, and gaseous form would need "even bigger" ones.

topic: Apple pins letters outlining employee benefits at US stores: Report
content: Apple has started publishing laminated copies of a letter in its US stores' backrooms highlighting and praising its benefits amid a union push, Bloomberg reported citing the letter. The two-page note outlines benefits such as vacation time, a 401(k) plan, product discount programs and health insurance. Each letter has been signed by the local individual managers.

topic: Meta, Twitter asked to store proof of potential Russian war crimes
content: Four Democratic lawmakers have asked the CEOs of YouTube, TikTok, Twitter and Meta to archive content that could be used as evidence of potential Russian war crimes in Ukraine. In their letter, the lawmakers said such content "could potentially be used as evidence as the US...and international human rights and accountability monitors investigate Russian...crimes...and other atrocities in Ukraine".

topic: Musk liking Dogecoin causes people to have meltdowns: Co-creator
content: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus took to Twitter to say, "I...enjoy that Elon Musk liking Dogecoin causes people to have pointless meltdowns because he isn't talking about their arbitrary crypto of choice, cloaked by frail moral superiority." Markus' tweet followed Musk's reply to another tweet by him. "It [Dogecoin] has potential as a currency," Musk had said.

topic: Google unveils new 10-shade skin tone scale to address bias in products
content: Google unveiled a new 10-shade skin tone palette at its I/O developer conference that it's incorporating into several of its products over the coming months. The Monk Skin Tone Scale is designed to replace outdated skin tone scales that are biased towards lighter skin. Beauty-related Google Images searches such as 'bridal makeup looks' now allow filtering results based on Monk.

topic: Chronological tweets are better than what algorithm suggests: Musk
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to say, "Chronological tweets seem much better than what 'the algorithm' suggests." He also asked users to tap on stars present in the upper right corner of their home page to revert to chronological order. Responding to Musk, Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey said, "This is the way...Having [a] choice is the most important."

topic: Robots may assemble UK's demonstrator solar power plant in space
content: The UK Space Energy Initiative has established a 12-year development plan that could lead to robots assembling a demonstrator solar power plant in orbit. This plant will beam gigawatts of power from space to Earth as early as 2035, the initiative's chairman said. The initiative was launched last year to explore options to develop a space-based solar plant.

topic: SpaceX shows Starlink's availability globally, India marked 'coming soon'
content: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX updated Starlink's availability globally, saying, "Starlink is now available in 32 countries around the world." It also released a map showing nations where the service is on the waitlist and others where it's expected to come soon. India, along with its neighbours Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Bangladesh and Bhutan, was marked under 'coming soon'.

topic: Tesla to face its 1st jury trial in US over fatal Model S crash
content: Tesla is set to face its first jury trial over a car crash after a US court rejected its request to dismiss a case without trial. In 2018, 18-year-old Barrett Riley, who was driving a Tesla Model S, died after his car engulfed into flames after hitting a wall at 116 miles/hour. The lawsuit alleges the car's battery was defective.

topic: Crypto billionaire reveals 7.6% stake in trading app Robinhood
content: Cryptocurrency billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried has revealed a 7.6% stake in Robinhood Markets, filings revealed. Bankman-Fried has said he doesn't have any intention of taking control of Robinhood. However, the filing also said he may "from time to time engage in discussions" with management. Shares of Robinhood were up more than 27% in after-hours trading following the disclosure.

topic: Meta tells Reality Labs staff it's planning cutbacks in the divison
content: Meta has told its Reality Labs employees that it's planning cutbacks in the division. Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth informed Reality Labs staffers to expect certain changes and that the division could not afford to do some projects anymore and would have to postpone others. A Meta spokesperson said the firm was not planning layoffs as part of the changes.

topic: Apple may drop iPhone Lightning port for USB-C in 2023: Report
content: Apple is planning to switch from the Lightning port on its iPhones to USB-C port in 2023, analyst Ming-Chi Kuo reported. He said that adopting USB-C "could improve iPhone's transfer and charging speed in hardware designs, but the final specification details still depend on iOS support." The EU had earlier proposed mandatory USB-C port on all devices, including iPhones.

topic: Disabled UPI payments because of informal pressure from RBI: Coinbase CEO
content: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong has said that the cryptocurrency exchange suspended its UPI payment method due to informal pressure from Reserve Bank of India (RBI). "India's Supreme Court has ruled that they can't ban crypto, but there are elements in the government there, including RBI, who don't seem to be as positive on it," he further said.

topic: Bill Gates tests positive for COVID-19
content: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates took to Twitter on Tuesday and wrote, "I've tested positive for COVID-19. I'm experiencing mild symptoms and am following the experts' advice by isolating until I'm healthy again." "I'm fortunate to be vaccinated and boosted and have access to testing and great medical care," he added.

topic: Apple discontinues iPod after 20 years
content: Apple on Tuesday announced that it is discontinuing the iPod touch, its last remaining music player model in the market. "iPod touch will be available while supplies last," the company said in a blog. Apple had introduced the first iPod on October 23, 2001, which had the capacity to store 1,000 songs in MP3 format and a 10-hour battery life.

topic: Netflix may start crackdown on password-sharing by end of 2022: Report
content: Netflix could launch lower-priced ad-supported plans in the final three months of 2022 and begin cracking down on password-sharing during the same time, the NYT reported. It said the details were mentioned in a note to Netflix employees by the company's executives. Notably, Netflix lost subscribers for the first time in over 10 years in the first quarter of 2022.

topic: I will reverse the 'flat-out stupid' Twitter ban on Donald Trump: Elon Musk
content: Elon Musk on Tuesday said that he will reverse Twitter's ban on former US President Donald Trump, adding that the ban was "morally wrong and flat-out stupid". Musk further said that the ban amplified Trump's views among people on the political right. Musk recently inked a $44 billion deal to acquire the social media platform.

topic: Stablecoin UST, that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, crashes to 40 cents
content: TerraUSD or 'UST', a stablecoin that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, plunged over 55% on Wednesday from 24 hours earlier to around 40 cents. Its sister token fell more than 80% to $5 and other cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ether also plunged. A stablecoin is a digital currency pegged to a "stable" reserve asset like the US dollar.

topic: Ukraine commander asks Musk for help, tweets 'People say you come from another planet'
content: The commander of a Ukrainian Marine Brigade has appealed to Elon Musk to help soldiers escape a steel plant besieged by Russian forces in Mariupol. Major Serhiy Volyna tweeted, "Elon Musk, people say you come from another planet to teach people to believe in the impossible...Help us get out of Azovstal...If not you, then who? Give me a hint."

topic: Govt calls out Twitter for violating India's free speech laws: Bloomberg report
content: The government has called out Twitter for violating the Indian Constitution and free speech rights, Bloomberg reported. The Ministry of Information Technology objected to the suspension of lawyer Sanjay Hegde's Twitter account about three years ago in a court filing last week, it further added. It had earlier said the matter was for Twitter and Hegde to resolve.

topic: Google Translate adds support for 24 new languages including 8 Indian languages
content: Google Translate is adding support for 24 new languages including eight new Indian language, the internet giant announced at its annual developer conference Google I/O 2022. Assamese, Bhojpuri, Sanskrit, Dogri, Konkani, Maithili, Meiteilon (Manipuri), and Mizo are among the added languages. Google said it is also adding indigenous languages of the Americas such as Quechua, Guarani and Aymara.

topic: Health, digital adoption among '5 megatrends' for the future: Tata Sons Chairman
content: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran has listed 'Digital adoption', 'Supply chain rebalance', 'Sustainability', 'Health' and 'Global talent pool' as the "five megatrends" for the future. He said these will have a "big impact" on economies, countries and businesses globally.  "All businesses will have to become AI and data businesses...No industry can escape this trend," he said on digital adoption.

topic: Musk jokingly agrees to hand over Twitter's control to YouTuber MrBeast if he dies
content: Elon Musk jokingly agreed to hand over control of Twitter to 24-year-old YouTuber MrBeast if he dies. Musk had tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya," after Roscosmos chief Dmitry Olegovich Rogozin accused the Tesla CEO of supplying "fascist forces in Ukraine". "Elon, you'll be held accountable like an adult," Rogozin said.

topic: I agree with Musk on bans, Trump's ban was a business decision: Dorsey
content: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey has said that he agrees with Tesla CEO Elon Musk that there shouldn't be permanent bans on individual Twitter users. This comes after Musk said he will reverse former US President Donald Trump's permanent Twitter ban. Dorsey said Trump's ban was a "business decision" and that "it shouldn't have been".

topic: Apple's top engineer quits due to company's return to office policy: Report
content: Ian Goodfellow, Apple's Director of Machine Learning, is reportedly leaving the company over its return to office policy. According to The Verge reporter Zoë Schiffer, Goodfellow told the company's staff, "I believe strongly that more flexibility would have been the best policy for my team." Starting May 23, Apple reportedly requires employees in the office three days a week.

topic: Deplatforming is a big deal: IT minister Chandrasekhar to Musk on Trump's Twitter ban
content: Union Minister of State for Electronics and Information Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar on Wednesday tagged Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Twitter and wrote, "Deplatforming is a big deal" on a news article about former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey backing Musk's plan to reinstate former US President Donald Trump's Twitter account. Chandrasekhar also wrote, "It's a violation of fundamental rights of users."

topic: Google teases smart glasses prototype that translates languages in real time
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on Wednesday teased a pair of smart glasses capable of translating languages in real time during Google's I/O developer summit. The company claimed that someone with the augmented reality glasses might be able to understand what another person is saying just by reading captions that are presented through the lenses while the other person speaks.

topic: $800 billion wiped off crypto market's value in a month
content: Crypto assets lost $800 billion in market value over the past month, touching a low of $1.4 trillion on Tuesday, as per data site CoinMarketCap. This comes as world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin briefly hit a 10-month low on Tuesday before rebounding to $31,450. Meanwhile, stablecoin TerraUSD lost a third of its value as it lost its peg to the dollar.

topic: Apple testing folding panel for iPhone and iPad: Report
content: Apple is developing a new folding OLED screen that would eventually be used in a folding iPhone or iPad, South Korea's TheElec reported. Apple is reportedly developing a polarizer-less OLED screen, the same technology which is used by Samsung in its Galaxy Z Fold3 and its Eco2OLED display. Currently, polarizer is being used in some conventional folding displays.

topic: 24x7 digital payments helpline 'DigiSaathi' now on WhatsApp: NPCI
content: The government's 24x7 helpline 'DigiSaathi' that provides information on digital payment products and services is now available on WhatsApp, the National Payments Commission of India (NPCI) said. Users can access the helpline by texting +91-892-891-3333 via WhatsApp. It answers queries on cards, UPI, NEFT, RTGS, Wallets, ATM, QR (UPI/Bharat), mobile and net banking, among others.

topic: Musk says Tesla is open to buying a mining firm in push for clean energy
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Tesla is open to buying a mining company in a push for the worldwide adoption of clean energy technologies. "It's not out of the question. We will address whatever limitations are on accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. It's not that we wish to buy mining companies," he added.

topic: Elon Musk's tweets on taking Tesla private were reckless: US judge
content: A US judge said in an April judgement that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 2018 tweets on taking Tesla private were inaccurate and reckless, adding "there was nothing concrete" about financing from Saudi Arabia's PIF. "Rather, discussions between Tesla and the PIF were clearly at the preliminary stage," the judge added. Musk has insisted that tweets were entirely truthful.

topic: Starlink resisted Russian hacks, but they're ramping up efforts: Musk
content: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a report on Russia attacking satellite internet in Ukraine said, "Starlink has resisted Russian cyberwar jamming and hacking attempts so far, but they're ramping up their efforts." Western nations' officials said Russia took tens of thousands of modems offline when the war started. Viasat's KA-SAT network had faced the attack in late February.

topic: Tesla recalls 1.3 lakh vehicles in US over display malfunction
content: Tesla is recalling about 1.3 lakh vehicles in the US following an overheating issue that may cause the center touchscreen display to malfunction, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said. The recall includes Tesla's 2021-2022 models S and X and its 3 and Y models from 2022. No crashes or injuries have been reported due to the issue, Tesla said.

topic: Musk's delay in disclosing Twitter stake under probe by US SEC: WSJ
content: The US SEC is investigating Tesla CEO Elon Musk's delay in disclosing his Twitter stake last month, the WSJ reported. Musk had revealed his 9.2% stake in Twitter to SEC on April 4, a delay of at least 10 days since surpassing the 5% threshold for revealing a shareholding. Musk has lately been embroiled in a dispute with the SEC.

topic: Google to pay over 300 news publishers in EU, more to follow
content: Google has agreed to pay over 300 publishers across the EU for their news and will roll out a tool for others to sign up too. However, Google has not revealed how much publishers will be paid. The EU had earlier adopted the copyright rules that require Google and other online platforms to pay news publishers for using their work.

topic: Spain dismisses spy chief over scandal involving Pegasus spyware
content: Spanish spy chief Paz Esteban has been dismissed over a dual phone-hacking scandal involving Pegasus spyware, Defence Minister Margarita Robles said. "Of course there are security flaws and there will continue to be," Robles said. Spain's National Intelligence Centre is also being questioned over its failure to prevent PM Pedro Sanchez and other officials' phones from being hacked using Pegasus.

topic: Chinese burn 3 am oil, Americans avoid going to work at all: Musk
content: The world's richest person Elon Musk praised Chinese workers in a recent interview. He said, "[Chinese] won't just be burning the midnight oil...they'll be burning the 3 am oil...whereas, in America, people are trying to avoid going to work at all." Musk added that most of Tesla's competition would come from China while adding, "There are...supertalented hardworking people in China."

topic: Will stay at Tesla as long as I can be useful: Elon Musk
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on being asked about how long he expects to stay at Tesla, said, "As long as I can be useful." Musk, who is in talks to buy Twitter, is expected to become the platform's temporary CEO. Earlier in July 2021, Musk had said he has tried "very hard not to be the CEO of Tesla".

topic: Experience a new era of cooling with Carrier air conditioners: Carrier
content: Carrier announced that as the inventor of modern air conditioning, it has kept in sync with evolving consumer demands for energy-efficient room air conditioners with advanced features. The 2022 range of air conditioners includes personalized cooling on a single click with Flexicool 6-in-1, faster cooling with Insta Cool and easy access to features with Carrier Smart Connect, the company stated.

topic: Rajasthan Royals becomes a Green Yodha: Schneider Electric
content: Energy automation company, Schneider Electric partners with Rajasthan Royals as their official sustainability partner. The collaboration aims to make cricket a sustainable sport. The team will play the IPL 2022 season's first carbon-neutral cricket match on May 11 as part of the Green Yodha sustainability initiative.

topic: Bitcoin briefly drops below $30,000 for first time since July 2021
content: Bitcoin, in the early hours of Tuesday, fell below $30,000 for the first time since July 2021. Its value fell as low as $29,764 on Tuesday before recovering above $30,000. Bitcoin's value has more than halved from its all-time high which was close to $69,000 in November. The fall in cryptocurrencies followed a drop in US equities and other markets.

topic: Twitter will comply with EU content rules after takeover: Elon Musk
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter will comply with European Union’s rules on content once his proposed takeover is completed. Musk met Thierry Breton, the EU’s Internal Market Commissioner on Monday for the same. The EU agreed on the Digital Services Act last month, which was aimed at urging technology platforms to better police their published content.

topic: Musk's $44 bn Twitter deal at risk of being repriced lower, warns short-seller
content: Elon Musk's $44 billion offer to buy Twitter could get repriced lower if he walked away from the deal, short-seller Hindenburg Research warned on Monday. "Musk holds all the cards here," Hindenburg, which has a short position on Twitter, said. "If Musk's bid for Twitter disappeared tomorrow, Twitter's equity would fall by 50% from current levels," it added.

topic: Where's edit button?: Musk's mom after mistake in her tweet about Taj Mahal
content: Maye Musk, the mother of the world's richest man Elon Musk who is buying Twitter, took to Twitter to share a picture from her Taj Mahal visit. "I went to the Taj Mahal in 2007...It is beautiful," she tweeted, however, she later tweeted, "Not 2007, 2012. Where is that edit button?" Earlier, Twitter confirmed it's working on an edit button.

topic: El Salvador buys $15 million worth of Bitcoin as it briefly drops below $30,000
content: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele on Tuesday took to Twitter to announce that the country has purchased 500 Bitcoins worth more than $15 million. "El Salvador just bought the dip," Bukele said, adding that the coins were bought at an average price of $30,744. The country's purchase comes after Bitcoin briefly fell below $30,000 for first time since July 2021.

topic: Sharp fall in tech stocks crazy, feels like dot-com boom: Zerodha CEO
content: Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath on Tuesday tweeted, "The sharp fall in the stock prices of high growth tech companies across the globe is getting crazy, feels like the dot-com boom." He added, "India has weathered the storm mostly because not many such companies are listed & many private ones raised a lot of money last year."

topic: New Indian VPN regulations are an assault on privacy: ProtonVPN
content: VPN service ProtonVPN, operated by a Swiss company, called India's new VPN regulations "an assault on privacy", adding that they "threaten to put citizens under a microscope of surveillance". "We remain committed to our no-logs policy," it added. The new VPN regulations released by CERT-In require VPN service providers to collect and hold user data for five years or longer.

topic: Layout of 'world's first Bitcoin City' in El Salvador unveiled, President shares pics
content: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele has shared the layout of the 'world's first Bitcoin City' that will initially be funded by Bitcoin-backed bonds. Bukele shared on Twitter pictures of a gold-coloured 3D model and rendered images of the city. 'Bitcoin City' will be constructed at the foot of a volcano which is being used to mine Bitcoin using geothermal energy.

topic: I saw the Taj Mahal in 2007, it's truly a wonder of the world: Elon Musk
content: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "It's amazing. I visited in 2007 and also saw the Taj Mahal, which truly is a wonder of the world." Musk was responding to a tweet that claimed to show a facade from a fort in Agra. Several Indian Twitter users responded to Musk's tweet, asking, "Any plans to visit India soon?"

topic: After Musk's Taj Mahal tweet, his mother says his grandparents flew there in 1954
content: After Elon Musk tweeted he visited Taj Mahal in 2007 and called it a "wonder of the world", his mother Maye Musk shared that his grandparents flew to the Taj Mahal from South Africa in 1954. She tweeted, "The only people to ever do this trip in a single-engine propeller plane, without a radio or GPS. Their motto 'Live dangerously...carefully'."

topic: Microsoft to help cover US employees' travel costs for abortion
content: Microsoft has said that it will cover travel costs for employees in the US who need to travel out of state for an abortion. The move comes after a recent draft leak from US Supreme Court proposed abolishing abortion rights nationwide. Several companies, including Yelp, Tesla and Amazon, among others have pledged to cover this cost for their American employees.

topic: Office as we know it, is over: Airbnb CEO on letting staff work remotely forever
content: After Airbnb allowed its employees to work remotely forever, the company's CEO Brian Chesky said, "I think that the office as we know it, is over." He added, "We can't try to hold on to 2019 any more than 1950. We have to move forward." Chesky questioned whether the office would be invented today if it didn't already exist.

topic: When are you coming to deliver 1st Tesla? Paytm CEO on Musk's Taj Mahal tweet
content: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to react to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet on the Taj Mahal. Sharma tweeted, "It'll be an incredible challenge for Tesla to build FSD for India. We're known to be the most unruly road users. That said, when are you coming here to deliver the first Tesla here at the Taj?

topic: Twitter has strong left-wing bias: Musk on tweet inciting violence against anti-abortionists
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter "obviously" has a strong left-wing bias. Musk was responding to Mike Cernovich, a right-wing activist and conspiracy theorist, who highlighted that "a verified account is allowed to incite terrorism without any care in the world about being banned". Cernovich had shared a screenshot of a journalist's tweet encouraging violence against anti-abortionists.

topic: Russia's Rutube remains offline for 2nd day, says, 'Hit with biggest cyberattack'
content: Russia's video platform Rutube remained offline for a second consecutive day on Tuesday after it was hit by a cyberattack just before it was about to stream the Victory Day parade in Moscow on Monday. "We have, in fact, been hit with the biggest cyberattack in Rutube's history," the platform said in a message on Telegram on Tuesday.

topic: Tinder-owner sues Google to stop its app from exiting Play Store
content: Tinder-owner Match Group has sued Google on Monday, calling the action a "last resort" to prevent Tinder and its other apps from being removed from the Play Store for refusing to share up to 30% of their sales. "Like any business, we charge for our services, and like any responsible platform, we protect users against fraud," Google said.

topic: Govt aiming to make India a global drone hub by 2030: Scindia
content: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said the government is aiming to make India a global drone hub by 2030. Addressing the 'Experience Studio on Drones' event organised by NITI Aayog, Scindia said the drone industry has a huge potential and can lead to 10,000 jobs. He added India would need nearly a lakh drone pilots in the coming years.

topic: Gay dating app Grindr to go public in $2.1 billion SPAC deal
content: Gay dating app Grindr has said it will go public through a merger with a blank-check acquisition firm, a deal that values it at $2.1 billion. The app's existing shareholders would own 78% of the company after the merger. Singapore-based SPAC Tiga Acquisition will be merging with Grindr. Under the deal, Grindr will receive $284 million in cash from Tiga.

topic: German antitrust body's data curb order 'clearly flawed': Meta
content: Meta on Tuesday said German antitrust watchdog's order to curb Facebook's data collection is "clearly flawed". The order, passed in 2019, said Facebook had abused its market power by collecting users' data without their consent and ordered it to stop. Meta also criticised the German watchdog for not cooperating with the Irish data protection regulator which supervises Facebook.

topic: Meta considers reducing money it gives news firms: Report
