content: Facebook-parent Meta is considering reducing what it pays to news organisations as it reevaluates its partnerships formed in the last few years, The Information reported citing sources. The firm has seen a drop in users clicking on links to news articles since former US President Donald Trump left office. Meta earlier said it was slowing the growth of its workforce.

topic: Ex-Facebook moderator sues Meta over working conditions in Kenya
content: A former moderator working for Meta has filed a lawsuit against it alleging poor working conditions for contracted content moderators in Kenya. The suit alleges workers moderating Facebook posts have been subjected to unreasonable working conditions including irregular pay and inadequate mental health support. Meta's local outsourcing company Sama has been sued as well.

topic: Indonesian President plans to meet Musk over nickel supply
content: Indonesian President Joko Widodo is planning to meet Tesla CEO Elon Musk during a US visit this week, the country's Coordinating Minister Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan said. He added that Musk's representatives were currently in Indonesia and due to visit the nickel production hub of Morowali. Indonesia wants to enter the global supply chain of the EV industry, Luhut said previously.

topic: Canada, US' electric aircraft firms want to manufacture in India: Scindia
content: Several electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) companies from the US and Canada are interested in setting up units in India, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday. He added that eVTOL aircrafts are currently being used by the defence forces of the two countries. An e-VTOL aircraft uses electric power to hover, take off and land vertically.

topic: Sony's Q4 operating profit more than doubles to $1.06 billion
content: Sony has reported that its fourth-quarter operating profit more than doubled to $1.06 billion, helped by strong performance in its gaming and network services business. Sony's profit for the three months to March 31 stood at $510 million a year earlier. For the current year, Sony forecast operating profit to fall to $8.8 billion from $9.2 billion.

topic: Blue Origin mission to fly first Mexican-origin woman to space
content: Billionaire Jeff Bezos-led Blue Origin has announced that NS-21 mission, the company's fifth human spaceflight, will include the first Mexican-origin woman to visit space. Katya Echazarreta, 26, is an electrical engineer and ex-NASA test lead. Her seat is sponsored by Space for Humanity and she will provide representation for women and minorities interested in STEM fields, Blue Origin said.

topic: What is the passwordless sign-in tech that Google, Apple & Microsoft teamed up for?
content: Google, Microsoft and Apple on May 5 announced they are teaming up to expand support for a common passwordless sign-in standard created by the FIDO Alliance and the World Wide Web Consortium. Through the new system, sign-ins will be possible through the same actions that users take to unlock their devices, like fingerprint or face verification or a device PIN.

topic: Bitcoin falls to the lowest level since January, trades below $34,000
content: Bitcoin fell on Monday to as low as $33,266 in morning trade, nearing January's low of $32,951 as slumping equity markets continued to hurt cryptocurrencies. It then steadied to trade above $33,600. According to BBC, the world's largest cryptocurrency has fallen by 50% since its peak in November 2021.

topic: 17-year-old boy builds 'mind-controlled' robotic arm in US, pic surfaces
content: A 17-year-old from Virginia in the US has invented a robotic prosthetic arm that can be controlled by the mind. Benjamin Choi used his sister's 3-D printer and some fishing line to print individual parts of the arm and then bolted them all together. It uses an artificial intelligence (AI) algorithm to interpret the user's brain waves.

topic: If I die under mysterious circumstances, nice knowing ya: Musk after Russian threats
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya." Shortly before this, Musk shared a post that he said was a statement by the Roscosmos director Dmitry Olegovich Rogozin to Russian media that accused Musk of supplying "fascist forces in Ukraine". "Elon, you'll be held accountable like an adult," the statement read.

topic: Elon Musk planning a new Twitter product codenamed 'X': Report
content: World's richest man Elon Musk, who's acquiring Twitter for $44 billion, plans to launch a new Twitter product codenamed "X", according to his investor presentation obtained by The New York Times. Musk expects to launch the product in 2023 and estimates it would have nine million subscribers in its first year and 104 million subscribers by 2028, the NYT reported.

topic: Japan will cease to exist, Venice dying due to very low birth rates: Musk
content: The world's richest man Elon Musk recently tweeted, "At the risk of stating the obvious, unless something changes to cause the birth rate to exceed the death rate, Japan will eventually cease to exist." He added, "This would be a great loss for the world." In another tweet, Musk said, "Venice is slowly dying due to very low birth rates."

topic: Best investment you'll make: Poonawalla suggests Musk to make Tesla cars in India
content: The Serum Institute of India's Adar Poonawalla on Sunday suggested Tesla CEO Elon Musk to invest in India by manufacturing Tesla cars in the country. Poonawalla wrote, "Just in case you don't end up buying Twitter, do look at investing...in India for high-quality large-scale manufacturing of Tesla cars. I assure you this will be the best investment you'll ever make."

topic: Job interest in Twitter rises over 250% after it accepts Musk's buyout deal
content: The interest in Twitter jobs on Glassdoor rose 263% in a week after Twitter accepted Elon Musk's $44 billion takeover bid. The data was shared on Twitter by Daniel Zhao, Glassdoor's lead data scientist. "Say what you will about Elon, he does have a large fanbase of people excited to work for him," Zhao tweeted.

topic: Amazon driver leaves 'kind' message for girl fighting cancer in US, Bezos reacts
content: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos took to Instagram Stories to share the story of Amazon driver Asani Anderson who left a message for an 8-year-old girl battling cancer in US while dropping off packages. "Amazon is praying 4 Aubrey luv you!" the message by Anderson read. Reacting to the gesture, Bezos wrote on Instagram, "Kindness makes our world better...Anderson embodies it."

topic: Baseless and untrue: ED as Xiaomi alleges it threatened staff with 'violence'
content: After Xiaomi alleged in a court filing that its top executives faced threats of "physical violence" during a probe by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), the agency responded saying that the claims are "untrue and baseless". The ED said that "there was no coercion or threat to the officers of the company" and that they deposed their statements before ED voluntarily.

topic: 'Got a call saying I'm laid off,' says woman days before she was due to join Meta
content: In a widely-shared LinkedIn post, Stephanie Washington, who was hired as a Recruiting Coordinator for Meta, said she was laid off just days before she was due to join the workplace. "I just signed...apartment lease 15 minutes before my manager called me...They are only compensating us for six weeks of pay after a month-long process of interviews," she wrote.

topic: Faulty battery cells caused e-scooter fires, initial govt probe finds: Report
content: An initial investigation by a government agency into the recent electric scooter fires in India has found faulty battery cells and modules as the leading cause, Reuters reported. The probe reportedly looked into fire incidents involving Ola, Okinawa and Pure EV scooters. "In Ola's case, the battery cells were found to be an issue," Reuters quoted a source as saying.

topic: Work ethic expectations from Twitter employees will be extreme: Elon Musk
content: The world's richest man Elon Musk tweeted "work ethic expectations would be extreme" after he completes the $44 billion acquisition of Twitter. He added that expectations from Twitter employees will be "much less than I demand of myself". Musk earlier said Twitter will be "super focussed" on software engineering, design, information security and server hardware after he acquires Twitter.

topic: Anonymity is an 'inherent risk' in use of blockchain tech: FM Sitharaman
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said anonymity is an "inherent risk" in use of blockchain technology and urged people to take precaution in future with a rise in the use of this technology. Calling distributed ledger technology (DLT) "beautiful", she added, "Unless we...guard ourselves against that anonymous element...we'll be exposing ourselves much more than...we would've imagined."

topic: I will do my best to stay alive: Musk to his mother after 'mysterious dying' tweet
content: Soon after Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a tweet about his "mysterious death", his mother Maye Musk commented that it wasn't funny. Responding to her, Musk wrote, "Sorry! I will do my best to stay alive." Musk's 'dying' tweet came after he shared a statement by the Roscosmos director that threatened him for supplying "fascist forces" to Ukraine.

topic: Tesla accuses ex-engineer of returning dummy laptop after stealing data secrets
content: Tesla has sued former engineer, Alexander Yatskov, for allegedly transferring confidential information on its supercomputer technology to his personal devices and turning over a "dummy" laptop to cover up theft. Yatskov quit in May and has refused to return the stolen data, claimed Tesla. The company also accused him of lying on his resume about his expertise and work experience.

topic: Twitter CEO's wife is General Partner at VC firm backing Musk's Twitter deal
content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal's wife Vineeta Agarwala is a General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz, the venture capital (VC) firm that has agreed to invest $400 million in Elon Musk's Twitter takeover deal. Vineeta leads investments for Andreessen Horowitz's biotech and medical fund. As per reports, Musk is expected to serve as the temporary Twitter CEO after he completes the takeover.

topic: Who is Jared Birchall, who manages the world's richest man Elon Musk's wealth?
content: Jared Birchall is the Managing Director of Excession, the family office of the world's richest man Elon Musk that handles his almost $250 billion fortune. Birchall also serves various roles at the Musk Foundation, Musk's school Ad Astra and his brain-implant startup Neuralink, and several of Musk's other LLCs. He has recently helped Musk secure financing for $44-billion Twitter takeover.

topic: I'm okay with going to hell: Musk after 'If I die under mysterious circumstances' tweet
content: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "I'm ok with going to hell, if that is indeed my destination, since the vast majority of all humans ever born will be there." Musk's tweet came hours after he tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya." Musk's tweets sparked speculation about whether he was receiving threats from Russia.

topic: Instagram to support NFTs from Ethereum, Polygon, Solana: Report
content: Instagram is set to allow users to post and share their non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on the platform, CoinDesk reported. As per the report, Instagram is planning NFT integration with Ethereum, Polygon, Solana and Flow, which are the networks that host the majority of trading in NFTs. The pilot will reportedly feature a small group of US-based NFT enthusiasts.

topic: Imported EV cells may not be suitable for Indian conditions: NITI Aayog member
content: Battery cells imported for electric vehicles (EVs) may not be suitable for Indian conditions, NITI Aayog Member VK Saraswat said after multiple incidents of EVs catching fire were reported from across the country. "We should make sure that whatever cells we manufacture are suitable for Indian conditions of high temperature," Saraswat said. We must rigorously test imported cells, he added.

topic: EU law regulating Apple, Google to come into effect in spring 2023
content: The European Union will begin enforcing the Digital Markets Act (DMA) in spring 2023, European Commission Executive Vice President Margrethe Vestager has stated. The antitrust law aims to curb the power of 'gatekeeper companies', including Meta, Google, Microsoft, Apple and Amazon. If found violating rules repeatedly, these entities could be fined up to 20% of their total global turnover.

topic: Apple China plant workers clash with guards over COVID-19 lockdowns
content: Hundreds of Apple Shanghai plant workers clashed with guards on Thursday after weeks at the plant under COVID-19 lockdown. The factory, owned by Taiwan's Quanta, has been operating under tight restrictions since the beginning of April. The employees are reportedly worried about positive COVID-19 cases on the campus. Tensions broke after workers tried to return to dormitories after their shifts.

topic: Facebook to drop Nearby Friends, other location-based features
content: Facebook has started notifying its users that its Nearby Friends, weather alerts, location history and other location-based features won't be available after May 31, 9to5Mac reported. All user information related to these features will reportedly be deleted from Facebook's servers. Users can download their background location data and location history till August 1, the report added.

topic: Humans will land on Mars within this decade: SpaceX President
content: SpaceX President and COO Gwynne Shotwell told CNBC that SpaceX will likely land humans on Mars before the end of the 2020s. "I think it'll be in this decade, yes. People on the moon, sooner," Shotwell said. She added, "We need to get a large delivery to the surface of Mars, and then people will start thinking harder about it."

topic: NVIDIA to pay $5.5 million penalty over cryptomining disclosures
content: NVIDIA has agreed to pay $5.5 million to settle civil charges that it did not properly disclose the impact of cryptomining on its gaming business. In consecutive quarters in FY 2018, NVIDIA failed to reveal that cryptomining was a "significant element" of its revenue growth from sales of chips designed for gaming. NVIDIA did not admit or deny the findings.

topic: L&T Infotech announces merger with Mindtree
content: Larsen & Toubro Infotech (L&T Infotech) on Friday announced that its board has approved a scheme of amalgamation and arrangement with Mindtree. Under the scheme, L&T Infotech will issue 73 shares for every 100 shares of Mindtree. After the completion of the merger, Larsen & Toubro Limited will hold a 68.73% stake in 'LTIMindtree', the combined entity.

topic: Xiaomi allowed to operate seized assets worth ₹5,551 crore by K'taka HC
content: Karnataka High Court has stayed the ED's decision to seize ₹5,551.27 crore from Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's bank accounts for suspected violations of foreign exchange laws. The court has allowed Xiaomi to operate its seized accounts for day to day activities. The company earlier said its "royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legit and truthful".

topic: Musk didn't have plan for Twitter: CEO of Binance which is investing $500 mn in buyout
content: Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao told Financial Times that the cryptocurrency exchange's $500 million investment to help Elon Musk acquire Twitter is "more of a blank cheque". He said, "[Musk] didn't have a plan for Twitter. There isn't...a business plan." Zhao further said, "After the investment...Elon will figure out what he wants to do, and we'll be supportive of that."

topic: WhatsApp working on feature to allow group admins to delete others' texts: Report
content: Meta owned WhatsApp is working on a new feature that will enable group admins to delete messages posted by other members on the group, as per a report. The move will reportedly enable admins to act as moderators of a group. Apart from this, WhatsApp is also working on extending the time to delete a message for everybody.

topic: Musk, Twitter sued by Florida pension fund to delay $44 bn deal
content: Elon Musk and Twitter were sued by a Florida pension fund seeking to stop Musk from completing his $44 billion buyout before 2025. The fund cited a Delaware law under which shareholders who own over 15% of a company can't enter a merger without two-thirds of remaining shares granting approval. Musk is effective "owner" of over 15% of Twitter shares.

topic: Govt asks VPN providers to store user data for 5 years or face up to 1 year in jail
content: The government's CERT-In requires VPN service providers to collect and hold user data for five years or longer under new rules applicable from June-end. Non-compliance may invite punitive action under subsection (7) of section 70B of the IT Act, 2000. Non-compliance may lead to up to one year of imprisonment or a fine of up to ₹1 lakh, or both.

topic: Musk denies Trump 'encouraged' him to buy Twitter, says 'had no communication'
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to react to a report that quoted Truth Social CEO Devin Nunes who said that Donald Trump had "encouraged" Musk to buy Twitter. Musk tweeted, "This is false. I’ve had no communication, directly or indirectly, with Trump, who has publicly stated that he will be exclusively on Truth Social."

topic: Airtel broadband suffers outage in parts of Delhi, Bengaluru & other cities
content: Several users took to Twitter after Airtel broadband services suffered a major outage in parts of Delhi and nearby cities on Friday night. While Airtel is yet to issue an official statement on this, reports say the services were also hit in Mumbai, Bengaluru, Jaipur and Hyderabad. According to website outage monitoring platform DownDetector.com, the outage affected millions of users.

topic: Swiggy agent books Dunzo to deliver man's order in B'luru, chat goes viral
content: A Twitter user in Bengaluru shared a screenshot of his chat where he revealed that while he had ordered coffee via Swiggy, the delivery agent booked a Dunzo delivery partner to deliver the item. Reacting to his tweet that is now going viral, Dunzo replied, "In the @peakbengaluru metaverse of madness, Bichoo gang and Eagle gang work together."

topic: Musk aims to increase Twitter's revenue to $26.4 bn by 2028: Report
content: World's richest person Elon Musk is aiming to increase Twitter's annual revenue to $26.4 billion by 2028, up from $5 billion last year, the New York Times reported citing a pitch deck by Musk to investors. Advertising will reportedly fall to 45% of total revenue under Musk, down from about 90% in 2020, generating $12 billion in revenue in 2028.

topic: Saudi Prince replies to Musk's 'How much of Twitter does the Kingdom own?' tweet
content: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal Al Saud has replied after Elon Musk asked, "How much of Twitter does the Kingdom own, directly & indirectly?" "I believe you will be an excellent leader for Twitter. Kingdom Holding Company and I look forward to roll our ~$1.9billion in the 'new' Twitter," Alwaleed tweeted. Earlier, Alwaleed opposed Musk's offer to buy Twitter.

topic: Musk told investors he could double their money if they backed Twitter deal: Report
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk told investors that he was highly confident he could double or triple their money if they backed his $44 billion buyout of Twitter, as per a report. He reportedly also said he could double Twitter's users to over 500 million by 2025. Musk is said to temporarily serve as Twitter CEO after the deal is closed.

topic: Which investors are giving Musk over $7 billion in new financing to buy Twitter?
content: Elon Musk has secured a new financing commitment of $7.139 billion for his $44 billion Twitter buyout. Investors include Binance, Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison, Brookfield, Fidelity, Qatar Holding, Sequoia Capital Fund, Aliya Capital, Honeycomb & Vy Capital among others. Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal, who initially opposed the buyout, has agreed to roll his $1.89 billion stake into the deal.

topic: L&T lnfotech CEO quits citing personal reasons as Mindtree merger announced
content: Larsen & Toubro lnfotech on Friday said that its CEO and Managing Director Sanjay Jalona has resigned from his position due to personal reasons. The development comes after L&T lnfotech announced its board has approved its merger with Mindtree. "Jalona has done a lot for the company and we are proud of him," Larsen & Toubro CEO SN Subrahmanyan said.

topic: Bled through my pants, couldn't get a tampon during meeting: TikTok ex-employee
content: A former employee at TikTok claimed that she bled through her pants instead of leaving a meeting to get a tampon amid the high-pressure work culture at the company. In a recent report, former employees have cited 85 hours of meetings a week, lack of sleep and mental anguish as some of the things they faced at the company.

topic: Apple's AirTags sending new kind of false alarms to iPhone users: Report
content: Apple’s AirTags are sending out new kind of false alerts to their owners, as per a report by the Wall Street Journal. As per the report, these false alerts generally occur in the middle of the night and have started in recent weeks. Such alerts are reportedly sending distorted map visuals and not showing the specific position of a person.

topic: EV-charging hub set up at B'luru mall, 50 cars can be charged at one time
content: Fortum Charge & Drive India has commissioned a public electric vehicle (EV)-charging hub at Forum Neighbourhood Mall in Bengaluru. According to the company, the charging hub will cater to all types of electric cars and compatible three-and two-wheelers and can charge 50 cars at one time. The company is planning to set up 200 EV charging points across the city.

topic: US judge dismisses Trump's lawsuit challenging his Twitter ban
content: A US judge has dismissed former President Donald Trump's lawsuit against Twitter that challenged his permanent suspension from the platform. Trump's argument that Twitter violated his right to freedom of speech guaranteed by the First Amendment of the US Constitution was rejected by the judge. He was banned after his supporters attacked the US Capitol on January 6, 2021.

topic: We encouraged Musk to buy Twitter: Trump's Truth Social CEO
content: Former US President Donald Trump's venture Truth Social CEO Devin Nunes in an interview said, "We encouraged Elon Musk to buy it [Twitter] because someone has to continue to take on these tech tyrants." "President Trump, basically before Elon Musk bought it, actually said to go and buy it," Nunes added. Nunes expressed that Musk will create a "different" Twitter.

topic: Investment bank Jefferies CEO's Instagram account hacked
content: Investment bank Jefferies Financial Group has said the Instagram account of its CEO Rich Handler has been hacked. "Any stories related to discounted sales of shares, crypto donations or donations to Ukraine...that appear on that hacked Instagram account are categorically false," Jefferies said. It is working with Instagram-owner Meta to get back control of the social media account.

topic: Tesla aims to run two shifts at Shanghai plant from May 16: Report
content: Tesla is aiming to run two shifts at its Shanghai plant from May 16, Reuters reported citing an internal memo. It plans to produce 2,600 electric cars from the Shanghai plant per day from then. Earlier, Tesla said it will turn Shanghai into "the world's largest vehicle export hub" with a new factory capable of producing 4,50,000 EVs per year.

topic: US teen sexually exploited by ex-Marine on Snapchat sues Snap, Apple
content: A 16-year-old US girl, who was "manipulated and coerced" by an ex-Marine to send nude photographs on Snapchat, has sued Snap, Apple and Google, claiming they fail to protect teenagers from "egregious harm". The man saved her photos and videos and shared them. The victim's lawyers blamed the firms' "tools and policies", saying they are designed to increase their wealth.

topic: Gucci to start accepting crypto payments in some US stores
content: Italian fashion company Gucci has announced that customers can pay with crypto at some of its flagship stores in the US starting later this month. The company will accept various digital currencies including bitcoin, ethereum, dogecoin, shiba inu, litecoin and a few US dollar-pegged stablecoins. The service will be expanded to its directly operated North America stores soon.

topic: China to ban minors from tipping livestreamers & watching after 10 pm
content: China has ordered internet platforms to stop underage users from tipping livestreamers or becoming livestreamers themselves without guardian consent. The platforms will also need to strengthen the management of peak hours for such shows and shows will need to be "forcibly" turned off by 10 pm local time for users of their parental control "youth mode" functions.

topic: Bitcoin drops 8.4% to $36,639 in biggest drop in almost a month
content: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin registered the biggest drop in almost a month on Thursday. It fell as much as 8.4% to $36,639 today after gaining 5.3% on Wednesday, which is the biggest intraday drop since April 11. Meanwhile, altcoins Ethereum, Avalanche and Solana were also down by 7.2%, 11% and 7.3% respectively.

topic: Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal under review by US FTC: Report
content: The US FTC is reviewing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $44 billion Twitter deal, Bloomberg News reported. The FTC will decide in June if it will do an in-depth antitrust probe of the proposed transaction. Musk's initial purchase of a 9% Twitter stake is already under an FTC probe to see if he complied with an antitrust reporting requirement.

topic: DiDi Prez, Lenovo founder go private on Chinese social media platform
content: The President of Chinese ride-hailing giant DiDi Chuxing Jean Liu and her father Liu Chuanzhi, the founder of Lenovo, have gone private on the Chinese social media platform Weibo. Earlier, both Jean and her father switched on a function on Weibo to hide all old posts. Neither had posted on the platform in the past six months.

topic: Turn your home into a smart home with Alexa Smart Home Combo: Amazon
content: With the launch of the Amazon Summer Sale on May 4, Amazon announced that customers can now convert their home into a smart home with Alexa Smart Home Combo at an unbelievable price of ₹2,999. The Alexa Smart Home Combo requires no rewiring and is easy to install, letting customers experience the convenience of hands-free voice control, the company added.

topic: Elon Musk secures over $7 billion in new financing to buy Twitter
content: World's richest man Elon Musk has secured $7.139 billion in new financing commitments for the acquisition of Twitter, a company filing showed on Thursday. The investors who committed financing include the world's largest crypto exchange Binance, Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison, Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital Fund among others. Last month, Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

topic: WhatsApp starts rolling out emoji reactions for messages
content: Meta-owned WhatsApp has started rolling out emoji reactions for messages, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced. Zuckerberg said WhatsApp is also adding the folded hands emoji "to help spread thanks and appreciation". "Emoji reactions are coming to WhatsApp so people can quickly share their opinion without flooding chats with new messages," WhatsApp had said in April.

topic: OnePlus 10R 5G with HyperBoost Gaming Engine available on open sale now
content: OnePlus announced that the open sale for its flagship OnePlus 10R 5G smartphone has begun today. The smartphone aims to deliver an improved gaming experience and features like 6.7" 120Hz FHD+ Fluid AMOLED display, MediaTek Dimensity 8100-MAX chipset & HyperBoost Gaming Engine. It offers two SUPERVOOC charging options, 150W and 80W, in Sierra Black & Forest Green editions.

topic: I regret WhatsApp's $22 bn sale to Facebook: WhatsApp's ex-CBO Arora
content: WhatsApp's former Chief Business Officer (CBO) Neeraj Arora tweeted, "I helped negotiate WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook (in 2014). Today, I regret it." He said, "Our stance was very clear: No mining user data, No ads (ever), No cross-platform tracking...Of course, that's not what happened." He added, "Today...WhatsApp is a shadow of the product we poured our hearts into."

topic: Looks like 'ax the itch': Musk on pic of US politician in 'Tax the Rich' Met Gala 2021 dress
content: Elon Musk on Tuesday took a dig at US politician Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez by tweeting, "Can only read one side. Looks like "ax the itch"?" on Met Gala 2021 picture. She wore an off-white dress with a 'Tax the Rich' message. A few days ago, Musk asked Alexandria to "stop hitting" on him over her "billionaire with an ego problem" tweet.

topic: He could make Twitter 'worse', but we should not underestimate him: Gates on Musk
content: At an event hosted by The Wall Street Journal, Bill Gates said Elon Musk actually could make Twitter "worse". "That's not his track record. I mean his track record with Tesla and SpaceX is pretty mind blowing...I kind of doubt that will happen this time, but we should have an open mind and never underestimate Elon," Gates added.

topic: WhatsApp's ex-CBO shares Co-founder's old handwritten 'No Ads! No Games!' note
content: WhatsApp's former CBO Neeraj Arora, who said that he regrets WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook in 2014, shared a handwritten note by WhatsApp Co-founder Brian Acton, that read, "No Ads! No Games! No Gimmicks!" WhatsApp's other Co-founder Jan Koum used to keep the note taped to his desk. WhatsApp Co-founders quit Facebook a few years after WhatsApp's acquisition.

topic: Apple stops accepting debit & credit cards for app purchases, subscriptions in India
content: Apple has stopped accepting debit and credit cards to buy apps from the App Store, use Apple subscriptions like iCloud+ and Apple Music in India. Apple's support page states that the company currently only supports net-banking, UPI and Apple ID balance as payment options. This comes after new auto-debit rules from RBI came into force last year.

topic: Sundar Pichai fact-checks his Wikipedia page edits, says 'I wasn't homeschooled'
content: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai during a recent interview fact-checked edits made by people on the Wikipedia page about him. On an edit claiming he was homeschooled, Pichai clarified, "I wasn't homeschooled." On edits naming several Indian schools that Pichai studied at, he clarified, "Two schools are right...the final school is 'Vana Vani', situated in the IIT Madras campus."

topic: Rocket Lab catches rocket booster returning from space using a helicopter
content: US-based space company Rocket Lab captured its rocket booster returning from space using a helicopter for a test. "The mid-air capture is a major milestone in our pursuit to make a reusable rocket to increase launch frequency," the company said. Rocket Lab used a combination of ropes, parachutes, a heat shield and a helicopter with two pilots for the test.

topic: Musk may become temporary Twitter CEO after buyout deal closes: Report
content: Elon Musk is expected to serve as Twitter's temporary CEO for a few months after he completes Twitter's $44 billion buyout, CNBC reported. Parag Agrawal is Twitter's current CEO after taking over the role from Co-founder Jack Dorsey in November 2021. A few days ago, Agrawal responded, "Nope! we're still here," to a Twitter user who thought Agrawal was fired.

topic: Google hires ex-civil servant Archana Gulati as India policy head: Report
content: Google has hired former civil services officer Archana Gulati as its public policy head in India, Reuters reported. Gulati, a telecom and competition policy expert who retired voluntarily at Sr. DDG (Additional Secretary Level), has been a financial advisor to the government for over 30 years. Until March 2021, she worked as Joint Secretary for Digital Communications at NITI Aayog.

topic: Musk plans to take Twitter public again 3 years after buyout: Report
content: World's richest man Elon Musk, who struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion and to take it private, could take the company public again after a few years, WSJ reported. Musk reportedly told potential investors that he plans to take Twitter public in as little as three years of buying it. Twitter's IPO took place in November 2013.

topic: Twitter may charge slight fee for commercial, government users: Musk
content: Elon Musk has said that Twitter will always be free for casual users but may charge a slight fee for commercial and government users. After the Tesla CEO struck a deal to buy Twitter, he said he wanted to enhance the platform with new features, make the algorithms open source to increase trust, defeat spam bots, and authenticate all humans.

topic: Facebook became Frankenstein monster, devoured user data: WhatsApp's ex-CBO
content: WhatsApp's former Chief Business Officer (CBO) Neeraj Arora, who regrets WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook in 2014, tweeted, "Nobody knew in the beginning that Facebook would become a Frankenstein monster that devoured user data and spat out dirty money." He added, "We didn’t either." Arora also said, "Tech companies need to admit when they have done wrong."

topic: 1,50,000 Ukrainians using Starlink internet service daily: Govt
content: About 1,50,000 people in Ukraine are using SpaceX's Starlink internet service each day, Ukraine Digital Minister Mykhailo Fedorov tweeted. He added, "This is crucial support for...restoring the destroyed territories. Ukraine will stay connected no matter what." This comes after SpaceX CEO Elon Musk activated Starlink service in Ukraine in February following Fedorov's request amid war with Russia.

topic: Meta freezes hiring for 2022 after slow revenue growth: Report
content: Facebook-parent Meta has temporarily stopped hiring for the remainder of 2022 and is lowering hiring targets, Reuters reported citing Business Insider. This comes after Meta last week recorded its slowest revenue growth in a decade. "In light of the expense guidance given for this earnings period, we are slowing [talent] growth accordingly," a Meta spokesperson said in an e-mailed statement.

topic: Google fires another AI scientist who challenged its findings: NYT
content: Google fired AI scientist Satrajit Chatterjee in March after he reportedly challenged a paper by the company, which had claimed that computers could design some chip components better than humans. As per New York Times, Google confirmed that Chatterjee was "terminated with cause" but declined to elaborate. Earlier, it fired two other AI team members, Timnit Gebru and Margaret Mitchell.

topic: Meta wristband to control smart glasses, other devices: Zuckerberg
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday shared a picture of eyewear maker EssilorLuxottica's chairman using a prototype of Meta's neural interface wristband. He wrote, "[The wristband] will eventually let you control your [smart] glasses and other devices." Last year, Meta had said it planned to develop a wristband that'd allow users to interact with a virtual world using finger movements.

topic: Twitter tests 'Circle' feature to share tweets with up to 150 people
content: Twitter has started testing a new feature called 'Twitter Circle' that will let users send Tweets to select people, the company announced on Tuesday.  A user can include up to 150 people in their Twitter Circle and only those individuals can interact with the Tweets shared in that Circle. Currently, the feature's available to a limited number of people globally.

topic: Facebook to shut down podcast service after a year on June 3
content: Facebook is shutting down its podcast service and will remove them altogether from its platform on June 3, Bloomberg reported citing a company note. Users won't be allowed to add podcasts starting this week while the Live Audio Rooms will reportedly be integrated into Facebook Live. Facebook had launched these in June 2021 in competition to Clubhouse live audio app.

topic: Facebook took action against 2.16 cr content pieces in India in March
content: Facebook 'actioned' against 2.16 crore pieces of content on the platform between March 1-31, Meta's compliance report released for March under the new IT Rules revealed. Of these content, 1.49 crore pieces were spam, followed by violent and graphic content at 25 lakh pieces. Facebook responded to all 656 reports it received through the Indian grievance mechanism, the report added.

topic: 78% of Indian organisations hit by ransomware in 2021: Survey
content: As many as 78% of Indian organisations were hit with ransomware in 2021, up from 68% in 2020, a survey by security vendor Sophos claimed. It said the average ransom paid by Indian organisations that had their data encrypted in most significant ransomware attacks was $1.2 million. Some 10% of victims payed ransoms of $1 million or more, it added.

topic: Negative comments do affect me, I'm not an android: Elon Musk
content: World's richest person Elon Musk, while speaking on Met Gala's red carpet, said that he's not immune to the negative comments made about him. "Well, it does get to me sometimes, I mean...I do have feelings. I'm not an android," he stated. He, however, added that he tries to "take these things with a grain of salt".

topic: LinkedIn to pay female workers in US $1.75 mn over pay gap claims
content: LinkedIn has agreed to pay $1.75 million in back wages to 686 female workers after the US Labour Department alleged that they faced "systemic, gender-based pay discrimination". As per the complaint, from 2015 to 2017, women working in engineering, product or marketing roles at two of LinkedIn's offices were paid less than their male counterparts. LinkedIn has denied the allegation.

topic: It's a free country: Musk on potential exodus of Twitter employees
content: Elon Musk said it's a "free country" after he was asked about a potential exodus of Twitter employees following his takeover on Met Gala's red carpet. "Certainly if anyone doesn't feel comfortable...they'll on their own accord go somewhere else. That's fine," Musk stated. As per Guardian, Twitter workers had raised questions about job security at a recently held company-wide meeting.

topic: Way above a 5% risk we haven't seen the worst of this COVID-19 pandemic: Gates
content: Bill Gates, who wrote the book 'How to Prevent the Next Pandemic', told the Financial Times, "We're still at risk of this pandemic generating a variant that would be even more transmissive and even more fatal." He added, "It's not likely...But it's way above a 5% risk that this pandemic, we haven't even seen the worst of it."

topic: I avoid things that are evil, stupid & make me look bad; Bitcoin does all 3: Munger
content: Berkshire Hathaway's Vice-Chairman Charlie Munger said, "I avoid things that are stupid, evil, and make me look bad in comparison to someone else." The billionaire added, "Bitcoin does all three." He said Bitcoin is "stupid" because he expects it to go to zero, "evil" because it undermines US financial system's integrity, and makes other countries "look foolish" compared to China.

topic: Govt warns Google Chrome users of high-level threat, asks users to update browser
content: The government's Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) highlighted multiple vulnerabilities in Google Chrome for Desktop in a 'high-severity' warning. Google Chrome's version prior to 101.0.4951.41 is affected. Vulnerabilities allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code, obtain sensitive information and bypass security restrictions. CERT-In requested users to update the browser.

topic: Mask for cows to neutralise their methane emissions wins award in UK
content: A wearable mask for cows to neutralise their methane emissions in real-time is one of the four winners of the inaugural Terra Carta Design Lab competition in the UK. Created by UK-based design group Zelp, the mask captures methane with each burp. A catalyst oxidises the gas and releases it into the atmosphere as carbon dioxide and water vapour.

topic: WhatsApp banned more than 18 lakh Indian accounts in March 2022
content: WhatsApp banned 18.05 lakh accounts in India in March 2022, the platform said in its latest monthly compliance report. The accounts were banned on the basis of complaints received from users and through WhatsApp's own mechanism to prevent and detect violations. WhatsApp also detailed the user complaints it received during the month and the corresponding action it took against them.

topic: World's richest man Musk walks Met Gala red carpet with his supermodel mother
content: The world's richest man Elon Musk walked the Met Gala 2022 red carpet with his 74-year-old supermodel mother Maye Musk. On being asked why the world's richest man would make time for Met Gala, Musk responded, "My mom wanted to come, so I brought my mom. That's the reason." Elon wore a black tuxedo while Maye wore a Dior gown.

topic: Nearly half of Elon Musk's Twitter followers are fake: Report
content: Nearly 48% of Elon Musk's 87.9 million Twitter followers are fake, TIME Magazine reported citing Twitter auditing tool SparkToro's data. These accounts are "unreachable and will not see Musk's tweets, either because they're spam, bots, propaganda, or because they're no longer active on Twitter," SparkToro said. Last month, Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

topic: MyPillow's millionaire CEO rejoins Twitter, banned again after 3.5 hours
content: American firm MyPillow's multi-millionaire CEO Mike Lindell was banned from Twitter on Sunday, 3.5 hours after making a return to the platform. Lindell, a supporter of ex-US President Donald Trump, was banned from Twitter in January 2021 for spreading misinformation about the 2020 election. Twitter said Lindell's account was permanently suspended for violating the platform's rules on ban evasion.

topic: Wikimedia Foundation, which runs Wikipedia, stops accepting crypto donations
content: The Wikimedia Foundation (WMF), which hosts Wikipedia, has announced that it will no longer accept donations in cryptocurrency. The WMF said it will also close its BitPay account, "which will remove our ability to directly accept cryptocurrency as a method of donating". The decision comes eight years after the organisation first began accepting donations in Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, and Ether.

topic: 'Paper-thin' loudspeaker that turns any surface into audio source made by MIT
content: Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have developed a "paper-thin" loudspeaker that can turn any surface into an active audio source. The loudspeaker weighs about as much as a dime and produces sound with minimal distortion. As per the researchers, the loudspeaker could be used like wallpaper to cover walls, cars, or aircraft interiors or for immersive entertainment.

topic: CIA's first-ever CTO Nand Mulchandani studied at a Delhi school
content: Nand Mulchandani, appointed as the US Central Intelligence Agency's (CIA) first Chief Technology Officer (CTO), did his schooling at Delhi's Bluebells School International. He has a degree in Computer Science and Math from Cornell and a Master of Science in Management from Stanford Business School. The Indian-American also learned Public Administration at Harvard's Kennedy School of Government.

topic: I would choose to marry her 'all over again': Bill Gates on ex-wife Melinda
content: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates has said that he would choose to marry ex-wife Melinda "all over again". "From my point of view it was a great marriage. I wouldn't have changed it. You know, I wouldn't choose to marry someone else," he added. The pair announced their decision to divorce in May 2021 after nearly 30 years of marriage.

topic: New Zealand-founded IT company offers unlimited leave to employees
content: New Zealand-founded IT company Actionstep is offering its employees unlimited annual leave, The New Zealand Herald reported. "This way, it covers everything like sick leave, bereavement and maternity," Actionstep's VP of engineering, Stevie Mayhew, said. "We're a team, we trust each other and we believe our best work happens when life & work is in good balance," the company said.

topic: Musk planning to put less of his money into buying Twitter: Report
content: The world's richest man Elon Musk, who struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion last month, is "tying up less of his wealth in the deal", Reuters reported. Musk is in talks with large investment firms and high net-worth individuals for the financing. The new financing, if secured, could reduce the $21 billion cash contribution committed by Musk.

topic: Tech blogger shares a glimpse of what Twitter's edit button could look like
content: Jane Manchun Wong, known for finding hidden features in companies' code, shared a glimpse of what she claims Twitter's edit button could look like. The Edit Tweet button allows users to create a new tweet with different content and a label saying 'Edited' appears at the bottom of edited tweet. Currently, users will have 30 minutes to make tweet edits.

topic: Making funny faces at the Met: World's richest man Musk on his Met Gala video
content: World's richest man Elon Musk responded to his video from the Met Gala, in which he was seen making goofy faces, by tweeting, "Making funny faces at the Met." Twitter account 'DogeDesigner' had shared the video with a tweet saying, "My entire net worth is in hands of this man." Musk attended the Met with his supermodel mother Maye Musk.

topic: Bored Ape NFT creator's virtual plots sell out for $285 mn of crypto
content: Bored Ape Yacht Club creator Yuga Labs raised $285 million worth of cryptocurrency by selling 55,000 virtual land plots related to its future metaverse project 'Otherside'. For each plot, it sold an NFT called 'Otherdeed' (worth $7,000), which could only be bought using the project's associated cryptocurrency ApeCoin. In total, the sold-out sale raked in 16,775,000 ApeCoin, as per Reuters.

topic: Activision shares rise after Buffett reveals owning 9.5% stake
content: Shares of Activision Blizzard rose nearly 3% on Monday after billionaire investor Warren Buffett said his company Berkshire Hathaway owned a 9.5% stake worth $5.6 billion in the video game maker. Activision shares were up $2.13, or 2.8%, at $77.73. However, this was still lower than the $95/share Microsoft offered as part of its $68.7 billion proposal to buy Activision.

topic: Musk takes feedback better than Zuckerberg: Facebook whistleblower
content: Facebook whistleblower Frances Haugen said that Elon Musk, who is buying Twitter for $44 billion, is better able to take hard feedback and make meaningful changes than Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg. "[Zuckerberg has] surrounded himself with people who tell him what he wants to hear," Haugen stated. She added that she's "cautiously optimistic" about Musk's takeover of Twitter.

topic: Amazon to pay US staff travel expenses of up to $4,000 for abortions
content: Amazon will cover up to $4,000 per year in travel costs for US employees seeking non-life threatening medical treatments, including elective abortion and transgender care. As per the announcement, the benefits will apply to treatments that are not available inside a 100-mile radius of an employee's home. This comes amid rising restrictions for abortion procedures in the US.

topic: Less than 5% of users are fake or spam accounts: Twitter
content: False or spam accounts represented less than 5% of Twitter's 229 million monetisable daily active users in Q1, the company estimated in a filing. This comes after Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, said one of his priorities will be to remove "spam bots" from Twitter. Around 48% of Musk's Twitter followers are fake, TIME magazine recently reported.

topic: Apple charged by EU antitrust regulators over mobile payments tech
content: European Commission on Monday charged Apple for restricting rivals' access to its Near-Field Communication (NFC) technology used for mobile payments. "The Commission's preliminary view is that [Apple]...restricts competition by reserving access to NFC technology to Apple Pay," the Commission said. EU regulators had last year accused Apple of distorting competition in the music streaming market.

topic: Current WHO funding is not at all serious about pandemics: Bill Gates
content: Billionaire Bill Gates has called for the establishment of a new global pandemic surveillance unit. He told the Financial Times, "The current WHO funding is not at all serious about pandemics." Gates claimed the WHO had fewer than "10 full-time people" preparing for future outbreaks prior to the outbreak of COVID-19 and "even they are distracted with many other activities".

topic: UPI hits record high transactions worth ₹9.83 lakh crore in April
content: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) recorded 5.58 billion transactions in April 2022, a new all-time high for the payments platform since its launch in 2016, NPCI data revealed. In value terms, UPI saw transactions worth ₹9.83 lakh crore in April. This is a 3.3% jump in volume of transactions from March 2022 and a rise of 111% on a year-on-year basis.

topic: Musk is visionary, he'll make Twitter open to diverse views: Zoho CEO
content: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu told ET Now that Elon Musk is a "great visionary" who will make Twitter more open to diverse viewpoints. Vembu said, "[Debates] have been particularly one-sided on Twitter...it is similar to the Cultural Revolution period of China." He added that both Musk and he are against the "cancel culture" rampant on Twitter.

topic: Google makes $100,000-online courses free to every US business
content: Google announced on Monday that it will provide any US business over $100,000 worth of online courses in data analytics, design and other tech skills for their workers free of charge. The offer marks an expansion of Google's Career Certificates, which was launched in 2018. As per Google, 205,000 people globally have earned at least one certificate through the program.

topic: India to build 1st indigenous hydrogen-fuelled electric vessel
content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways has decided to develop India's first indigenous hydrogen-fuelled electric vessel at Cochin Shipyard Ltd (CSL). The Ministry said the vessel will cost  ₹17.50 crore, of which 75% will be funded by the Central government. The hydrogen-based fuel cells are environment-friendly and already being used in bus, truck, and train applications, it added.

topic: Introducing realme GT NEO 3 with world's fastest 150W charging: realme
content: realme announced the launch of realme GT NEO 3 on April 29. Priced at ₹29,999* this is the world's first and fastest 150W charging flagship which gives you 50% charge in just 5 minutes, the brand revealed, adding that the Dimensity 8100 5G processor makes it realme's first dedicated display processor. The sale begins on May 4 at noon.

topic: ₹5,551 crore seized from Xiaomi India bank accounts for forex violations: ED
content: Assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore of Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited have been seized in connection with "illegal outward remittances made by the company", the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said on Saturday. The assets lying in bank accounts have been seized under provisions of the Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999, the agency added.

topic: Jack Dorsey, Peter Thiel encouraged Musk to take Twitter private: WSJ
content: A group of "libertarian-leaning activists and businessmen", PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel, and Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey encouraged Elon Musk to take Twitter private, the Wall Street Journal reported. Musk and Dorsey believed Twitter could be run more effectively as a private company and they focussed on its role as a potential public good, the WSJ said, quoting former executives.

topic: You'll always be my Captain: Musk as Shatner says 'hire me as Twitter's face'
content: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "You will always be my Captain," after actor William Shatner asked Musk to hire him "as the face of Twitter". The 91-year-old played the role of Captain James T Kirk of USS Enterprise in 'Star Trek' franchise. Shatner also wrote, "Since it seems to be the latest "thing"...I'm stating that I'm staying on Twitter."

topic: ISMC to invest ₹22,900 crore to set up India's 1st chip-making plant in Karnataka
content: International semiconductor consortium ISMC will invest ₹22,900 crore ($3 billion) to set up India's first and largest semiconductor fabrication unit in Karnataka, the state government announced on Sunday. ISMC is a joint venture between Abu Dhabi's Next Orbit Ventures and Israel's Tower Semiconductor. The chip-making plant is expected to generate over 1,500 direct and 10,000 indirect jobs.

topic: Each and every EV fire incident will be probed: Transport Secretary
content: Each and every incident of electric vehicles (EVs) catching fire will be investigated, Road Transport and Highways Secretary Giridhar Aramane told PTI. There have been multiple incidents of EVs catching fire recently, resulting in deaths and severe injuries to people. Aramane said an expert panel has been formed to enquire into the matter and it hasn't submitted its report yet.

topic: Same Xiaomi allowed to donate ₹10 cr to PM-CARES Fund: Moitra on ED seizure
content: TMC leader Mahua Moitra on Saturday reacted to the Enforcement Directorate's seizure of Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore over Forex law violations. Moitra said the same Xiaomi was earlier "allowed to donate ₹10 crore to opaque PM-CARES Fund". Notably, Congress had earlier questioned why PM Modi's COVID-19 fund was accepting donations from Chinese companies.

topic: I could have done things differently: CEO Parag on Twitter's past performance
content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal acknowledged during a company-wide meeting that the microblogging site could have performed better over the years. "Yes, we could have done things differently and better. I could have done things differently. I think about that a lot," Agrawal said. He also urged the company's staff to expect change in the future under new leadership.

topic: Indian-American Nand Mulchandani to be CIA's first-ever CTO
content: Indian-American entrepreneur Nand Mulchandani has been named the US government's Central Intelligence Agency's (CIA) first-ever Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Mulchandani is a serial entrepreneur who has co-founded and been CEO of startups namely Oblix, Determina, OpenDNS and ScaleXtreme. He has studied at Cornell University, Stanford Business School and Harvard's Kennedy School of Government.

topic: Over $200 billion wiped off Amazon’s market value in its biggest 1-day drop since 2006
content: Amazon stock sank 14% in its biggest one-day drop since July 2006, with the shares closing on Friday at their lowest level since June 2020. With this, more than $200 billion was wiped off from the company's market valuation. This comes after the e-commerce giant reported quarterly loss for the first time in seven years.

topic: Stop hitting on me: Musk to US politician on 'billionaire with ego problem' tweet
content: After US' Democratic congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez took to Twitter and blamed hate crimes on "some billionaire with ego problem" who "unilaterally controls a massive communication platform", Elon Musk tweeted, "Stop hitting on me, I'm really shy." Alexandria replied, "I was talking about Zuckerberg, but ok," before deleting it. Musk recently reached a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

topic: Our royalty payments, bank statements are legit: Xiaomi as ED seizes ₹5,551 cr
content: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) seized Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore "in connection with illegal outward remittances", the company said, "As a brand committed to India, all our operations are firmly compliant with local laws and regulations." Xiaomi further said, "We believe our royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legit and truthful."

topic: Electric scooter catches fire in Tamil Nadu, owner escapes by jumping off burning vehicle
content: An electric scooter caught fire in Hosur, an industrial hub in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri district, on Saturday causing panic in the area, PTI reported. The owner, Satish Kumar, a supervisor at a Bengaluru firm, escaped after he jumped down from the burning scooter. Kumar had bought the vehicle last year. Recently, multiple reports of electric scooters catching fire have surfaced.

topic: Not a bad idea: Musk on using Dogecoin to authenticate humans on Twitter
content: Elon Musk, who is acquiring Twitter for $44 billion, said it's "not a bad idea" to use Dogecoin to authenticate humans on Twitter. He was responding to billionaire investor Mark Cuban's idea of Twitter users putting up one Dogecoin for unlimited posts. "If anyone contests a post and humans confirm it's spam, they get the spammer's Doge," the investor said.

topic: Netflix fires staff months after hiring them, offers 2 weeks of severance pay
content: Netflix confirmed to Fortune that it has fired 25 employees from its marketing department, including 10-12 writers and editors from its in-house publication Tudum. Several of these writers tweeted that they were fired just months after being hired with the promise of more stability. A fired Netflix employee tweeted the company offered two weeks of severance pay to fired workers.

topic: Political cartoon shared by Elon Musk listed as NFT, fetches bids of $3,550
content: A political cartoon that was recently shared by billionaire Elon Musk has been listed as an NFT (non-fungible token) by its creator Colin Wright. "The cartoon depicts the political landscape shifting beneath my feet, so that my once moderate left-wing views are now seen as right-wing and problematic," Wright said. The top bid for NFT is currently 1.25 Ether ($3,550).

topic: If you offered me all the Bitcoin in the world for $25, I wouldn't take it: Buffett
content: Warren Buffett, the world's sixth richest person and Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, said if someone offered him all of the Bitcoin in the world for $25, he wouldn't take it. "What would I do with it? I'd have to sell it back to you one way or another," the 91-year-old added. Buffett also said that Bitcoin doesn't produce anything tangible.

topic: Musk sells 9.6 million Tesla shares worth $8.5 bn in a week
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold a total of 9.6 million Tesla shares worth $8.5 billion this week. He offloaded about 4.4 million shares on April 26 and April 27. He sold an additional 5.2 million shares on April 28, new filings on Friday showed. The latest string of sales follows announcement of Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal.

topic: Far-right US activist told he may get his Twitter account back soon: WSJ
content: Charles Johnson, a far-right activist in the US, has been told by a close associate of Elon Musk that he may "soon" get his account back after Musk buys Twitter, according to a Wall Street Journal report. Johnson was banned from Twitter in 2015 after he used the platform to fundraise to "take out" Black Lives Matter activist DeRay McKesson.

topic: Don't believe permanent ban is right: Ex-Twitter CEO Dorsey
content: Ex-Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, in an apparent hint to the permanent suspension of Donald Trump's Twitter account in 2021, said he doesn't believe that any permanent ban, with the exception of illegal activity, is right. A "transparent system", both in policy and operations, is more important than whether Twitter is run by a company or an open protocol, Dorsey added.

topic: 17 lakh Fitbit watches recall doesn't cover all burn-causing models: Lawsuit
content: A lawsuit has claimed that Fitbit's recent recall of 17 lakh of its Ionic smartwatches, over reports that overheating batteries caused burn injuries, doesn't cover all similar defective models. Other versions of the device also burn users and can burst into flames, two US women claimed. "Reasonable consumers...purchase the products to burn calories, not their skin," the women's lawyers said.

topic: Apple sued in Russia for pulling its payment service amid war
content: Russian law firm Chernyshov, Lukoyanov & Partners has sued Apple seeking $1.28 million in damages for consumers affected by Apple withdrawing its payment service from Russia amid the Ukrainian war. The demand includes compensation for "moral damage" caused to citizens. The total figure could rise as the law firm is still inviting more claimants to join the suit.

topic: The word 'metaverse' is hypothetical, we don't use it: Snap CEO
content: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel has said his company doesn't use the word "metaverse" because it's "pretty ambiguous and hypothetical". He said, "Just ask a room of people how to define it, and everyone's definition is...different." "When we talk about AR, we're trying to augment the real world around you. Our fundamental bet is that people...love the real world," he added.

topic: Meta appeals against ban for 'extremist' acts in Russia: Report
content: Facebook-parent Meta has appealed to a Russian court against a ban imposed on some of its activities in Russia due to "extremism", Interfax news agency reported citing a press release. Russia in March found Meta guilty of "extremist activity". However, it said the ruling wouldn't affect its WhatsApp messenger service in the country.

topic: Musk clearly a genius who thinks on another level: Twitter Co-founder
content: Twitter Co-founder Evan Williams has said Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "clearly a genius who thinks on another level". However, he acknowledged Musk's polarising reputation, comparing him to the Web3 idea. "I think what we're also seeing is people project either their hopes and dreams or their worst nightmares. And it's like Elon and Web3 are the same," he added.

topic: Far-left hates everyone, I'm no fan of the far-right either: Musk
content: World's richest person Elon Musk took to Twitter to say, "The far-left hates everyone, themselves included!" He added that he is "no fan of the far-right either". "Let's have less hate and more love," he further said. Musk's tweets follow his previous statement on making Twitter a "politically neutral" platform to earn the public's trust.

topic: After Weibo, China's WeChat to reveal user locations on posts
content: China's messaging service WeChat has said it will start revealing the location of users when they post on a public account. It will soon begin testing the setting which applies only to users of its "public platform", where they may comment on content published by official accounts. This comes right after Weibo started publishing users' IP locations.

topic: $170 billion wiped off Amazon's market value in its biggest drop since 2014
content: Shares of Amazon fell as much as 12% on Friday in its biggest intraday percentage drop since July 2014, wiping off about $170 billion from the company's market valuation. The company's shares declined after it reported a loss of $3.8 billion for Q1 2022, marking its first quarterly loss since 2015. Amazon also posted the slowest sales growth since 2001.

topic: Twitter overcounted its users for 3 years due to an error
content: Twitter admitted it overcounted its monetisable daily active usage/users (mDAU) from Q1 2019 through Q4 2021. "In March 2019, we launched a feature to let people link multiple separate accounts together to conveniently switch between accounts," said Twitter. "An error was made at that time...actions taken via primary account resulted in all linked accounts being counted as mDAU," added Twitter.

topic: Apple may make iPhones worth ₹47,000 crore in India this fiscal: Report
content: Apple's contract manufacturers in India are expected to make iPhones worth ₹47,000 crore in FY23,  The Economic Times reported. This will be almost five times the ₹10,000 crore worth of iPhones made by Apple's contract manufacturers Foxconn and Wistron in India in FY22, the report added. Earlier this month, Apple's manufacturing partner Foxconn began making iPhone 13 in India.

topic: I supported Obama, but extremists have hijacked Democratic Party now: Musk
content: World's richest person Elon Musk has tweeted, "I strongly supported Obama for President, but today's Democratic Party has been hijacked by extremists." Earlier, he shared a diagram showing himself once being closer to moderate liberals on the centre-left but moving closer to conservatives on the centre-right as years progressed. The diagram also showed liberals moving to extreme left thinking.

topic: Nilekani helping govt build platform to take on Amazon, Flipkart: Report
content: Infosys' billionaire Co-founder Nandan Nilekani is helping the government build "a freely accessible online system where traders and consumers can buy and sell everything from detergent bars to airline tickets," Bloomberg reported. It is called the Open Network for Digital Commerce, or ONDC. Its objective is to curb Amazon and Walmart-owned Flipkart's domination in India, Bloomberg report added.

topic: Wipro plans to hire 38,000 freshers in FY23
content: Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte said the company hired over 19,000 freshers in FY22 and expects to double the number in FY23. Wipro added 45,416 employees on a year-on-year basis during the financial year, taking its total headcount to 2,43,128. The company said it plans to increase the frequency of promotion cycle for 70% employees in junior bands to quarterly basis.

topic: Zuckerberg's wealth increases by $11 billion in his biggest one-day gain ever
content: Meta Platforms' 37-year-old CEO Mark Zuckerberg added $11 billion to his fortune in the biggest one-day gain he has ever had, Bloomberg reported. His personal wealth surged as Meta shares soared 17.6% on Thursday after it reported that Facebook added more users than expected in first quarter of 2022. Zuckerberg is now the world's 12th-richest person with $75.9 billion wealth.

topic: Airbnb tells employees they can work remotely forever
content: Airbnb told its 6,000 employees that they would have the option to permanently work remotely. The home-renting marketplace also told its US employees that they could move to anywhere in the country without a reduction to their compensation. Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky said that permanent flexibility will allow the company to "hire and retain the best people in the world".

topic: Elon Musk has lined up a new CEO for Twitter: Report
content: World's richest person Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, has lined up a new CEO for the company, Reuters reported. Musk earlier told Twitter Chairman Bret Taylor that he doesn't have confidence in Twitter's management. Twitter's current CEO Parag Agrawal will reportedly receive $42 million if he's terminated within 12 months of a change in control at Twitter.

topic: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $4 bn, says no further sales planned
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold 4.4 million Tesla shares worth nearly $4 billion, filings showed. Commenting on the sale he said, "No further TSLA sales planned after today." Earlier this week, Tesla lost $126 billion in value amid investor concerns that Musk may sell shares to fund his $21 billion equity contribution to his $44-billion Twitter deal.

topic: Nandan Nilekani is India's Elon Musk for me: Snapdeal CEO
content: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl said that Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani is India's Elon Musk for him. "Whether it's Infosys, Aadhaar, UPI and now ONDC (Open Network for Digital Commerce), his impact on India and its global standing is nothing short of incredible," Bahl tweeted. While Nilekani's personality is distinct compared to Musk's, the quantum of his impact isn't, he added.

topic: No such instruction: Govt on reports of halting electric 2-wheeler launches
content: The government has denied reports claiming it has asked electric two-wheeler makers to halt new launches until EV fire incidents were investigated. "There is no such instruction and such reports are unfounded, misleading and far from the truth," the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways tweeted. Earlier reports said government also cautioned manufacturers who haven't reported any fire incidents.

topic: Musk's initial 9% Twitter stake purchase under probe in US: Report
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's initial 9% Twitter stake purchase in early April is being probed by the US FTC, The Information reported. The FTC is probing if Musk complied with an antitrust reporting requirement when he bought the stake. It's focussing on whether Musk bought the stake to influence Twitter's management or if he looked to be a passive shareholder.

topic: Aave CEO briefly suspended from Twitter after joke on being its interim CEO
content: DeFi protocol Aave's CEO Stani Kulechov's Twitter account was briefly suspended after he joked about being appointed Twitter's "interim CEO". However, less than 24 hours after the suspension, Twitter reversed its decision. After the suspension was lifted, Kulechov tweeted, "I'm back as interim CEO of Twitter." Prior to his suspension, Kulechov had thanked Elon Musk for the opportunity.

topic: PM Modi inaugurates Semicon India 2022 conference in Bengaluru
content: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated Semicon India 2022 conference in Bengaluru, saying, "Semiconductors are playing a critical role in the world in more ways than we can imagine." The conference is being organised by India Semiconductor Mission. "It's our collective aim to establish India as one of the key partners in the global semiconductors supply chain," PM Modi added.

topic: Apple's Q2 revenue rises 9% y-o-y to record $97.3 billion
content: Apple announced that it has posted a March quarter revenue record of $97.3 billion, up 9% year-over-year. Its total profit was $25 billion up from over $23 billion recorded in the same period last year. Its iPad sales revenue fell 2% to $7.65 billion due to supply-chain constraints, while revenue from Mac computers rose 14.7% to $10.4 billion.

topic: Google blocked 12 lakh Play Store apps, 1.9 lakh developers in 2021
content: Google has revealed that it blocked 12 lakh "policy violating apps" from being published on Play Store in 2021. According to Google, it also banned 1,90,000 "malicious and spammy" developer accounts and closed around 5,00,000 developer accounts that were "inactive or abandoned". "Last year we introduced multiple privacy-focused features...and improved SDK data safety," Google stated.

topic: Swiggy to pilot use of drones for Instamart deliveries
content: Swiggy has said it will pilot the use of drones for its online grocery service, Instamart, starting May. The drones will be used to replenish stocks between seller-run dark stores and from a store to a common customer point. The orders will then be picked by delivery partners who will deliver them to the customers.

topic: Bitcoin adopted as legal tender in Central African Republic
content: The Central African Republic has adopted Bitcoin as legal tender, a spokesperson for President Faustin-Archange Touadera told Bloomberg on Thursday. "By legalising the use of Bitcoin, CAR hopes to attract investors," the spokesperson stated. Notably, it is the first African and only the second country in the world to do so after El Salvador, which adopted Bitcoin in September 2021.

topic: Twitter reports revenue miss, user growth for Q1 days after Musk deal
content: Days after agreeing to sell to Elon Musk for $44 billion, Twitter released its earnings report for Q1 2022 on Thursday. Its daily active users number was up by 15.9% y-o-y to 229 million, compared with analysts' estimates of 226.8 million. However, Twitter's revenue was slightly below the estimated $1.23 billion. It earned $1.2 billion, an increase of 16% y-o-y.

topic: Parliamentary panel summons Amazon, Google over competitive conduct
content: The Parliamentary Panel on Finance has said it'll summon Google, Amazon, Twitter, Facebook, Apple and Microsoft among others to discuss their competitive behaviour. It comes as the Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Thursday told the panel that it was setting up a 'Digital Markets and Data Unit' for dealing with anti-competition practices of big tech companies.

topic: Following Musk's life is like taking notes while drinking from fire hose: Biographer
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's biographer Walter Isaacson has said dealing with Musk's life is "like trying to take notes while drinking from a fire hose. It keeps coming fast". He added everybody wants to talk about Musk and "everybody's got thoughts about him". "I don't think he's as random as he allows himself to appear," Isaacson said.

topic: Trump's Truth Social exists as Twitter censored free speech: Musk
content: Ex-US President Donald Trump's social media platform Truth Social exists because "Twitter censored free speech", Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, said. However, he added that Truth Social is a "terrible" name and it should be called "Trumpet" instead. As per its website, Truth Social intends to give users space for "open, free and honest global conversation".

topic: Google starts building its largest campus outside US in Hyderabad
content: Google began building its largest campus outside of its US headquarters in Hyderabad's Gachibowli on Thursday. The 3 million-square-foot building will have a capacity to employ 14,000 people and is located on a 7.3-acre site. Google had acquired the land in 2019 after an agreement was signed between Google and Telangana's IT Minister KT Rama Rao in 2015.

topic: Russia fines Twitter 3 mn rubles for not deleting banned content
content: A Russian court fined Twitter three million rubles ($41,000) for not removing banned content from its platform, local media reported citing the court. The illegal content reportedly included posts with instructions on how to make Molotov cocktails, among others. Earlier, Russia fined Google the same amount for refusing to remove banned content from YouTube.

topic: China's Weibo publishes users' IP locations to combat 'bad behaviour'
content: China's Weibo has started publishing users' IP locations on their account pages and when they post comments, in a move to combat "bad behaviour" online. For users in China, Weibo will display their province or municipality, while for overseas users IP addresses will be shown. Several users welcomed Weibo's decision, while several others brought up anonymity issues.

topic: Activision Blizzard shareholders approve $68.7 bn Microsoft deal
content: Call of Duty-maker Activision Blizzard's shareholders have approved Microsoft's $68.7 billion proposal to buy the firm. Over 98% of the shares voted at a special meeting were in favour of the proposed transaction. Microsoft announced in January that it had agreed to acquire Activision Blizzard in its biggest acquisition to date. Microsoft's $26.2 billion LinkedIn acquisition is its second-biggest.

topic: OnePlus 10R 5G, Nord CE 2 Lite 5G and Nord Buds set to be launched today
content: OnePlus presents 'More Power to You', unveiling its latest array of products across categories. The OnePlus 10R 5G will come with 150W SuperVOOC charge support and MediaTek Dimensity 8100 MA processor whereas the OnePlus Nord CE 2 Lite will feature a 64MP AI triple camera setup. The new OnePlus Nord Buds will sport 12.4 mm dynamic bass drivers.

topic: Twitter's top lawyer Vijaya Gadde abused online after Musk's tweets target her
content: Twitter's top lawyer Vijaya Gadde is being targeted with abusive tweets after Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, criticised a content decision of Twitter's legal team. On a user's tweet about Gadde, Musk criticised Twitter's 2020 decision to block a story about Hunter Biden. Musk also tweeted a meme about Twitter's alleged "left-wing bias", which featured Gadde.

topic: I wish Musk the very best, our social media rules remain unchanged: MoS IT
content: Rajeev Chandrasekhar, the Union Minister of State (MoS) for Electronics and Information Technology, told ET, "I wish Elon Musk the very best," as the world's richest person struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion. He added that the government's goals and expectations of accountability and safety rules for all social media intermediaries, including Twitter, remain the same.

topic: Twitter-Musk deal includes $1 billion termination fee for both the parties
content: Elon Musk will have to pay Twitter a fee of $1 billion if he terminates his $44 billion cash deal for the social media company, according to a regulatory filing. Twitter will have to pay the same fee under specified circumstances if it terminates the deal. The deal could be terminated if not closed by October 24, the filing added.

topic: Nope! we're still here: Twitter CEO Parag after user says 'I thought we were fired'
content: Responding to a user who tweeted, "I thought we were fired," Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal wrote, "Nope! we're still here." Reacting to his reply, Twitter users wrote, "Hopefully, for not much longer," and "Better start looking now." Earlier, a report said Agrawal would receive $42 million if he's terminated within 12 months of a change in control at Twitter.

topic: I took this job to change Twitter for the better: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal
content: After Elon Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Thursday tweeted, "I took this job to change Twitter for the better, course correct where we need to, and strengthen the service." "Proud of our people who continue to do the work with focus and urgency despite the noise," he added.

topic: Musk says Twitter needs to be politically neutral for public trust, explains what he means
content: The world's richest person Elon Musk, who recently announced that he would buy Twitter, has said, "For Twitter to deserve public trust, it must be politically neutral." He further explained that it effectively means "upsetting the far right and the far left equally". Earlier, Musk said that former US President Donald Trump's Truth Social exists because Twitter censored free speech.

topic: Proud of our people who are working with focus despite the noise: Twitter CEO
content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Thursday said, "Proud of our people who continue to do the work with focus...despite the noise." Earlier, Agrawal told his employees, "There are no plans for any layoffs at this point." Recently, a report claimed that Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde cried in a meeting expressing concerns over Musk's takeover.

topic: Don't feel for me: Parag on entrepreneur's 'I feel for Twitter CEO' tweet
content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal responded to an entrepreneur who had tweeted, "I feel for the current CEO of Twitter - he had all these plans and now lives with the same uncertainty of his whole team." Responding to entrepreneur Suhail Doshi, Agrawal tweeted, "Thank you but don't feel for me...What matters most is the service and the people improving it."

topic: Will take considerate view on crypto, it can't be rushed: FM
