content: The government will take a considerate decision on cryptocurrency regulation but it can't be rushed through, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. However, she added that the government is open to promote innovation made in the distributed ledger technologies. "Our intention is in no way to hurt this (innovation around crypto)...but (we need to) define for ourselves," she stated.

topic: Meta's shares surge 19% as Facebook reports user growth in Q1 2022
content: Facebook-parent Meta's shares surged 19% during pre-market trading in New York, a day after it reported that Facebook added more users than projected in Q1 2022. Facebook had 1.96 billion daily users in Q1 2022, a return to growth after its first-ever decline in Q4 2021, Meta reported on Wednesday. Meta's shares climbed as high as $210.14/share following the report.

topic: Meta reports 21% drop in profits in 2nd straight quarterly decline
content: Facebook parent Meta reported a 21% y-o-y decline in its profit for Q1 2022 at $7.5 billion, marking the company's second consecutive quarterly decline. Meta's revenue however grew 7% to $27.91 billion from $26.17 billion. Meanwhile, Facebook's daily active user count also increased 4% y-o-y to 1.96 billion after declining in Q4 2021 for the first time.

topic: Apple opens Self Service Repair to iPhone users in US
content: Apple on Wednesday announced the launch of Self Service Repair in the US. As part of the facility, owners of iPhone 12, 13 and third-generation SE can go through repair manuals, and then buy the parts required to fix common issues with the handsets online. The service will be expanded to additional countries, starting with Europe, later this year.

topic: Ex-Twitter CEO tells Musk 'bullying isn't leadership', he reacts
content: Former Twitter CEO Dick Costolo reacted to Elon Musk's response to Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde reportedly crying over his takeover and expressing concerns, saying, "Bullying is not leadership...You're making an executive at the company you just bought...target of harassment." In response, Musk said, "What are talking about? I'm just saying Twitter needs to be politically neutral."

topic: Amazon permanently lifts ban on mobile phones in warehouses: Report
content: Amazon has permanently lifted the ban on mobile phones in warehouses allowing workers to keep mobile phones with them on the job, Bloomberg reported citing an internal email. "We recognise the desire for employees to keep their mobile phones...and...last two years have demonstrated that we can safely do so," it said. The new policy will be applicable worldwide.

topic: Your rules won't apply here: EU to Musk over Twitter deal
content: The European Union has warned that Elon Musk-owned Twitter will have to respect the bloc's rules regarding online content moderation. "Elon, there are rules...It's not your rules which will apply here," said EU Internal Market Chief Thierry Breton. He added that if Twitter fails to comply, the EU could fine 6% of its annual revenue or even ban it entirely.

topic: US judge rejects Musk's bid to end Tesla tweets review under SEC deal
content: A US judge has rejected Tesla CEO Elon Musk's bid to end the condition to have his tweets on Tesla vetted by a competent lawyer before posting, a requirement under his US SEC deal. Musk has claimed he was forced to agree to the deal. The judge said Musk's free speech argument against the deal is "meritless" and "particularly ironic".

topic: Elon Musk wins $13 bn suit over $2.6 bn Tesla-SolarCity deal
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has won a $13 billion lawsuit over Tesla's $2.6 billion acquisition of SolarCity, which Tesla shareholders had called a "bailout". They accused Musk of coercing Tesla's board into buying the struggling SolarCity, to rescue his investment. However, the US court found that Musk "was more involved in the process than a conflicted fiduciary should be".

topic: CCI conducts raids against Amazon, Flipkart's Indian sellers: Report
content: The CCI has launched raids against some Indian sellers of Amazon and Flipkart over alleged violation of competition laws, Reuters reported citing sources. The raids were carried out against two of Amazon's sellers, Cloudtail and Appario, while no details on Flipkart's sellers were reported. Both the firms have earlier been accused of promoting preferred sellers on their websites.

topic: Political neutrality is easy: Cuban after Musk says Twitter must be neutral
content: Billionaire investor Mark Cuban in response to Elon Musk's comment on making Twitter "politically neutral" said, "It's easy to be politically neutral. It's hard to be neutral about health and safety issues." Earlier, Musk said that to "deserve" the public's trust, Twitter "must be politically neutral". He added that it "effectively means upsetting the far-right and...far-left equally".

topic: Global chipmakers evaluating sites in India for new plants: Govt
content: Some of the world's biggest chipmakers are evaluating locations in India for new plants, Communications, Electronics and IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told Bloomberg Television. India is in discussion with some of the world's largest firms to attract them into the country. "India is right there squarely on their global plans whether it is Intel, GlobalFoundries," he added.

topic: Reels hard to monetise despite being popular: Zuckerberg
content: Reels account for over 20% of the time that users spend on Instagram, but they're hard to monetise for now, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said during the company's Q1 2022 earnings call. He added that currently AI recommendations are driving more of user feeds than social content. This will unlock "interesting" content that users would've otherwise missed, he noted.

topic: UK govt proposes seizing crypto assets to help against economic crime
content: The UK government has proposed seizing crypto assets to help combat economic crime. It told the parliament's Treasury Select Committee that the creation of a civil forfeiture power would "mitigate the risk posed by those that cannot be prosecuted but use their funds to further criminality". The parliamentary inquiry recommended creating a single body to tackle economic crime.

topic: Baidu, Pony.ai get 1st permits to deploy driverless robotaxis in China
content: Baidu and Pony.ai have received permits from Beijing city authorities to deploy their robotaxis without a safety driver, marking the first time such permits have been given in China. Both the firms are allowed to offer rides to the general public on open roads within a 60 square kilometre area in the Beijing Economic and Technological Development Area.

topic: Musk is revealing just how unserious a person he is: Ex-Twitter exec
content: Former Twitter executive Jason Goldman in an interview discussing Elon Musk's Twitter takeover said, "The company really could use great stewardship at this point and what he's revealing is just how unserious a person he is." He also criticised Musk's plan to relax speech restrictions, saying it "reveals a very naive and unserious approach to...content moderation issues he will face".

topic: Obama loses, Bolsonaro gains followers as Musk buys Twitter: Report
content: Barack Obama lost 3,00,000 followers while Katy Perry and Taylor Swift lost 2,00,000 and 1,00,000 followers respectively after Elon Musk bought Twitter on Monday, NBC reported. Meanwhile, right-wing politicians including Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro and US Representative Marjorie Greene gained several followers. Responding to the report, Twitter said the "fluctuations" were "organic".

topic: Russia says it will wait & see how Musk's ownership affects Twitter
content: Russian spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday that Russia will wait and see how billionaire Elon Musk's ownership of Twitter will affect the platform. He also said that he doubted Western social media's capability to reflect different points of view. The statement comes as a Russian court reportedly fined Twitter $41,000 for not removing banned content from its site.

topic: AMD Days Sale is now live on Flipkart
content: AMD announced AMD Days Sale on Flipkart featuring offers on laptops, desktops, and AIOs for casual, enthusiast, professional gamers, students, and working professionals. The sale will be live on 27th-28th April for customers to get extra ₹1,000 off on prepaid orders and up to 12 months of No Cost EMI on a range of laptops powered by AMD Ryzen™ processors.

topic: Xiaomi launches Xiaomi 12 Pro 5G in India at starting price of ₹62,999
content: Xiaomi has launched the Xiaomi 12 Pro 5G in India at a starting price of ₹62,999. The smartphone is equipped with Snapdragon® 8 Gen 1, a 50MP triple rear camera and 4,600 mAh battery that supports 120W fast charging, and comes in the colours Couture Blue, Noir Black and Olive Mauve. The sale will go live on May 2.

topic: Tesla loses $126 billion in value amid Musk Twitter deal funding concerns
content: Tesla lost $126 billion in value amid investor concerns that CEO Elon Musk may have to sell shares to fund his $21 billion equity contribution to his $44 billion buyout of Twitter. Tesla isn't involved in Twitter deal, however its shares have been targeted by speculators after Musk declined to disclose where his cash for the acquisition is coming from.

topic: Musk likes a cartoon about him on 'setting the blue bird free'
content: Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, liked a cartoon on Twitter about the acquisition. "Elon Musk has finally set the blue bird free," the tweet accompanying the cartoon read. "Free speech is the bedrock of a functioning democracy, and Twitter is the digital town square where matters vital to the future of humanity are debated," Musk has said.

topic: Twitter tracking how many new hires turn down job offers due to fears over Musk: Report
content: Managers responsible for hiring at Twitter have been asked to keep track of how many prospective employees turn down job offers because of fears about Elon Musk, according to internal communications reviewed by The New York Times. Employees at Twitter also fear that Musk might end the company's flexibility about returning to the office, the report said.

topic: Trump's Truth Social beating Twitter & TikTok: Musk on pic of Apple Store's top charts
content: Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, tweeted a screenshot of Apple Store's top charts. "Truth Social is currently beating Twitter & TikTok on...Apple Store," he wrote. Truth Social, an alt-tech social media platform, was founded by ex-US President Donald Trump in February. "That means you also buy Apple Store now and sort it out," a user jokingly wrote.

topic: Twitter Co-founder Dorsey eligible for $978 mn cash payout after Musk's deal: Reports
content: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey, who owns a 2.4% stake in the company, is eligible for a $978 million cash payout after Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter for $44 billion, according to reports. According to Musk's deal, he would be buying about 18,042,428 shares of Twitter that are owned by Dorsey for $54.20 each, the reports added.

topic: Musk barred from disparaging Twitter when tweeting on $44-bn deal
content: World's richest person Elon Musk has been barred from disparaging Twitter or its representatives while tweeting about his $44-billion deal to buy the platform, a new securities filing showed. The filing has details of the transaction, including a section on "public announcements". Musk is still allowed to discuss the deal on Twitter if he follows the condition on his tweets.

topic: '#leavingtwitter' trends on Twitter in India after Elon Musk buys the platform
content: Hours after Elon Musk announced that he was buying Twitter for $44 billion, '#leavingtwitter' began trending on Twitter in India. The hashtag was used in over 29,000 tweets, with tweets like, "Finally, it's out there: Twitter is an autocratic platform as Elon Musk buys Twitter #leavingtwitter." Several users also used the hashtag to troll people leaving Twitter over Musk's takeover.

topic: Musk usually does what he says he is going to do: Billionaire investor Novogratz
content: Billionaire investor Mike Novogratz has tweeted, "The hysteria around Elon Musk buying Twitter is unsettling. While his style might not be for everyone, he usually does what he says he is going to do." "Give him a chance to remove the bots. For that alone we will all be thanking him," Novogratz wrote.

topic: You got Twitter out of an impossible situation: Dorsey to Musk, Parag
content: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey thanked Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal and Elon Musk after Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for about $44 billion. "Thank you both for getting the company out of an impossible situation," tweeted Dorsey. He further said that both Musk and Agrawal have a goal of creating a platform that is "maximally trusted and broadly inclusive".

topic: Elon Musk explains what he meant by 'free speech for Twitter'
content: After he struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Elon Musk explained, "By 'free speech', I simply mean that which matches the law. I am against censorship that goes far beyond the law. If people want less free speech, they will ask government to pass laws to that effect," he tweeted.

topic: Twitter's top lawyer cried in meeting over Elon Musk takeover, claims report; Musk reacts
content: Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde cried in a meeting expressing concerns over Elon Musk's takeover, a report claimed. Reacting to it, Musk tweeted, "Suspending...Twitter account of...major news organization for publishing a truthful story was obviously incredibly inappropriate." Musk referred to Twitter banning an article about US President Joe Biden's son Hunter's overseas business dealings.

topic: Pair of Nike's NFT sneakers that can be worn in metaverse sell for ₹1 crore
content: A pair of Nike's NFT sneakers, equipped with rare skins, that can be worn in metaverse was sold for over ₹1 crore (45 Ether). Nike recently launched a collection of 20,000 NFT sneakers, along with RTFKT. The sneakers are selling for 2.5 to 3 Ether. The sneakers' appearances can be changed with digital vials, worth at least 0.8 Ether.

topic: Robinhood fires 9% full-time employees, cites 'hyper growth'
content: Citing "hyper growth", Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev has said the trading platform is firing 9% full-time employees. "This rapid headcount growth has led to some duplicate roles...and more layers and complexity than are optimal," Tenev added. "After carefully considering these factors, we determined that making these reductions to staff is the right decision to improve efficiency," Tenev further said.

topic: Was there nothing better to do with $44 billion: Simu on Musk's Twitter takeover
content: Hollywood celebrities reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal. Shang-Chi actor, Simu Liu tweeted, "Was there nothing better to do with 44 billion dollars?" Priyanka Chopra's brother-in-law, singer Kevin Jonas wrote, "Will we now get the edit tweet option?" In a joint statement with Twitter, Musk said that he wants to make the Twitter service "better than ever".

topic: China's DJI to halt Russia, Ukraine sales to see products not used in war
content: Chinese drone maker DJI Technology will temporarily suspend business in Russia and Ukraine to ensure its products are not used in the war. "DJI abhors any use of our drones to cause harm, and we are temporarily suspending sales in these countries," DJI said. Ukrainian officials and citizens have accused DJI of leaking data on the Ukrainian military to Russia.

topic: Russian court orders seizure of Google's assets worth $6.6 mn: Report
content: A Russian court has ordered the seizure of 500 million roubles ($6.67 million) worth of Google's property and funds in Russia in connection with Google's restrictions on a Russian firm's YouTube channel, Reuters reported citing news agencies. The case concerns GPM Entertainment Television. News agency RIA reported that the court had rejected a previous claim by GPM on April 13.

topic: If Bezos can afford $500 mn yacht, he can give decent wages: Sanders
content: US Senator Bernie Sanders took to Twitter to comment on Amazon's Jeff Bezos and said, "If Jeff Bezos can afford a $500 million yacht and fancy multimillion-dollar homes all over the world...He can afford to pay workers at Amazon decent wages." He added that the workers can also be given "decent benefits" and "good working conditions".

topic: Musk hasn't backed projects that aren't game-changers: Ukraine Vice PM
content: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal saying, "Over the past decades, Elon Musk has not invested in projects that are not the game-changers of the industry." He added that he is sure an "unexpected turn in the development of social media" is on its way.

topic: Russia fines Meta for not deleting 'LGBT propaganda' post: Report
content: A Russian court has fined Meta four million roubles ($54,030) for failing to delete posts containing "LGBT propaganda", news agency Interfax reported. As per Russian law, "promotion of non-traditional sexual relations to minors" is prohibited. Last month, Russian communications regulator said it drew up two administrative cases against Google for failing to remove banned content from YouTube.

topic: China rejects speculation it may try to influence Twitter after Musk's deal
content: Chinese foreign ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin has rejected the speculation that Beijing could try to use leverage over Tesla in order to influence Twitter. This came after Elon Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion. Following the deal, Amazon's Jeff Bezos had tweeted, "Did the Chinese government just gain a bit of leverage over the town square?"

topic: Saudi PIF head committed to take Tesla private with me: Musk
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to a news channel discussing texts between Saudi PIF and him, saying, "The head of Saudi PIF committed unequivocally to take Tesla private with me, as witnessed by...Tesla CFO and several others." The channel said the texts "confirm they were serious about taking Tesla private". "That is why I said funding was secured," Musk added.

topic: France's Atos moves services delivered from Russia to India, Turkey
content: French IT consulting group Atos is moving its services currently delivered from Russia to other countries, including India and Turkey, amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war. Atos said the feasibility of the move has required significant planning in terms of implications for business operations and employees based in Russia. Atos stock lost half of its market value last year.

topic: Google-parent Alphabet's Q1 profit drops by over $1 billion
content: Google-parent Alphabet's net profit dropped to $16.4 billion in the first quarter compared to last year's $17.9 billion in the same quarter. Its revenue shot up 23% from the same period last year, reaching $68 billion. The company reported $54.66 billion in advertising revenue for the quarter, up from $44.68 billion the year prior.

topic: Instagram tests feature to let users pin posts to their profile
content: Instagram is testing a new feature to let users pin specific posts to their profile above their photo grid. Users who have access to the feature in the test phase are seeing a 'Pin to your profile' option that can be selected from the three-dot menu next to posts. Currently, users have the option to pin Stories to their profiles.

topic: Musk's ideas would be great for Twitter: Largest ad group WPP CEO
content: World's largest advertising group WPP CEO Mark Read in an interview with Bloomberg Television discussed Elon Musk's Twitter deal, saying, "Many of his ideas around fake bots, and improving the algorithms...would be great for the platform, great for users and great for our clients," Read said. He added he doesn't expect any potential crackdown on advertising on Twitter in future.

topic: Elon Musk to buy Twitter for $44 billion
content: Twitter has accepted the world's richest man Elon Musk's bid to take over the social media company. It entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by an entity wholly owned by Musk, for $54.20 per share in cash in a transaction valued at approximately $44 billion. Upon completion of the transaction, Twitter will become a privately held company.

topic: I want to make Twitter better than ever: Musk after $44 bn takeover deal finalised
content: Elon Musk, after finalising his $44 billion Twitter buyout deal, said, "I want to make Twitter better than ever by enhancing the product with new features." He added that he looks to make Twitter better by "making the algorithms open source to increase trust, defeating the spam bots, and authenticating all humans". He added, "Twitter has tremendous potential."

topic: Twitter CEO Parag set to receive $42 mn if terminated after Musk's takeover: Reports
content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal would get an estimated $42 million if he is terminated within 12 months of a change in control at the social media company, according to reports quoting research firm Equilar. Musk in a securities filing had said he did not have confidence in Twitter's management. Musk has struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

topic: No job cuts at the time: Twitter CEO as Elon Musk acquires company for $44 billion
content: After Elon Musk struck a deal to acquire Twitter for $44 billion, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal told the employees that there won't be any job cuts "at the time". "Once the deal closes...we don't know which direction [Twitter] will go," he added. Parag reportedly told Twitter employees that Musk's transaction to take Twitter private could take six months to complete.

topic: Twitter set to accept Musk's $43 billion offer: Report
content: Twitter is set to agree on its sale to the world's richest man, Elon Musk, for around $43 billion in cash, Reuters reported on Monday. It is the price that Musk had called his "best and final" offer for the social media company. Twitter may announce the $54.20-per-share deal later on Monday, Reuters added.

topic: Musk tweets 'And be my love in the rain' amid reports of Twitter takeover deal
content: Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "And be my love in the rain." His tweet came after several reports said that Twitter is set to accept Musk's $43-billion takeover offer. Responding to Musk's tweet, Dogecoin's co-creator tweeted, "The birds have less to say for themselves...In the wood-world's torn despair...Than now these numberless years the elves...Although they are no less there."

topic: Elon is the singular solution I trust: Jack Dorsey on Musk's $44-bn Twitter takeover
content: After Elon Musk struck a $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter, the micro-blogging platform's billionaire  Co-founder Jack Dorsey tweeted, "In principle...I don’t believe anyone should own or run Twitter." He added, "It wants to be a public good at a protocol level, not a company. Solving for the problem of it being a company however...Elon is the singular solution I trust."

topic: EV startup Fisker CEO removes Twitter account after Musk's $44-bn deal
content: US EV startup Fisker CEO Henrik Fisker's Twitter account has ceased to exist after Elon Musk's $44-biilion Twitter deal announcement. Fisker said in a tweet Monday that his followers should look for him on Instagram for future updates, without giving away any additional details. Fisker, who worked with Tesla earlier, was sued by Tesla claiming he stole confidential information.

topic: I hope that even my worst critics remain on Twitter: Elon Musk
content: Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I hope that even my worst critics remain on Twitter, because that is what free speech means." His tweet came after several reports claimed that Twitter is set to accept Musk's $43 billion offer to buy the company. Republicans cheered the potential Twitter deal, hoping the former US President Donald Trump will return to Twitter.

topic: Actress Jameela Jamil quits Twitter after Elon Musk buys it for $44 billion
content: Actress Jameela Jamil announced that she's leaving Twitter after Elon Musk purchased the platform for $44 billion. "Ah he got twitter...I'd like this to be my what lies here as my last tweet...I fear this free speech bid is going to help this hell platform reach its final form of totally lawless hate, bigotry, and misogyny...Best of luck," she wrote.

topic: Musk's Boring Company to start testing Hyperloop at full-scale this year
content: Billionaire Elon Musk's The Boring Company will begin testing high-speed transport system Hyperloop at full-scale later this year. Earlier today, Musk tweeted, "In the coming years, Boring Company will attempt to build a working Hyperloop." He noted that Hyperloop would be the fastest way of getting from one city centre to another for distances less than 3,220 km.

topic: Meta to open its first physical retail store in US next month, Zuckerberg shares pics
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg took to Instagram to share that the company will open its first physical retail space, called 'Meta Store', on May 9. The 1,550 sq ft storefront is situated on Meta's campus in Burlingame, California. The store will let customers "get hands-on experience" with its Portal videophones, Ray-Ban Stories smart glasses and Quest 2 virtual reality headsets.

topic: If Musk can afford Twitter, he can pay his taxes: US Congresswoman
content: US Congresswoman Marie Newman reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal, saying, "If he can afford Twitter, he can damn well afford to pay his fair share in taxes." She highlighted that Musk had paid $0 in federal taxes in 2018. "We need a Billionaire Tax NOW," she added. US Senator Elizabeth Warren has called the deal "dangerous" for democracy.

topic: Twitter impacts the entire world: CEO Parag as Musk bags deal to buy Twitter
content: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal took to Twitter after the world's richest man Elon Musk's $44 billion offer to buy Twitter was accepted by the social media company's board. "Twitter has a purpose and relevance that impacts the entire world," tweeted Agrawal. He added, "Deeply proud of our teams and inspired by the work that has never been more important."

topic: Won't return to Twitter even if account reinstated after Musk takeover: Trump
content: Former US President Donald Trump has said he'll not return to social media platform Twitter even if his account is reinstated following the platform's purchase by billionaire Elon Musk. Trump added he will formally join his own Truth Social startup over the next seven days. "Musk will make improvements to Twitter and he is a good man," Trump further said.

topic: Don't know which direction Twitter will go: CEO Parag to employees over Musk takeover
content: On being asked about Elon Musk's plans for Twitter following a $44-billion takeover, CEO Parag Agrawal told his employees, "Once the deal closes...we don't know which direction [Twitter] will go." "When we've an opportunity to speak with Elon...it's a question we should address with him," he added on being asked whether ex-US President Donald Trump would be allowed to return.

topic: Free speech bedrock of functioning democracy: Musk as Twitter accepts buyout offer
content: The world's richest person Elon Musk said, "Free speech is the bedrock of a functioning democracy," after Twitter accepted his offer to take the social media company private for approximately $44 billion. He added, "Twitter is the digital town square where matters vital to the future of humanity are debated." Musk will buy each Twitter share for $54.20 in cash.

topic: Elon Musk's old Twitter chat on 'buying Twitter' goes viral
content: After Twitter accepted the world's richest man Elon Musk's bid to take over the social media company, an old Twitter chat between Musk and a Business Insider host has gone viral. In 2017, Musk tweeted, "I love Twitter," to which the host replied, "You should buy it then." Responding to the host, Musk had tweeted, "How much is it?"

topic: Did China just gain a bit of leverage over town square: Bezos on Musk's Twitter takeover
content: Sharing a tweet by a journalist pointing out connections between Tesla and the Chinese government following Elon Musk's deal to buy Twitter, Jeff Bezos tweeted, "Did the Chinese government just gain a bit of leverage over the town square?" He added, "My own answer...is probably not. The more likely outcome...is complexity in China for Tesla, rather than censorship at Twitter."

topic: Musk responds to his alleged old e-mail on Twitter, Instagram; shares 'Instagram curse'
content: Elon Musk, who has offered to buy Twitter, responded to an e-mail he allegedly wrote in August 2018 about Twitter and Instagram. In the e-mail, Musk allegedly wrote, "Will tweet as I wish and suffer the consequences...I just deleted my Instagram. Weak sauce." On Monday, Musk responded to the e-mail by tweeting, "The Instagram curse: Water everywhere, yet always thirsty."

topic: BMW to help create tool to trace carbon footprint of batteries
content: A group of 11 carmakers and battery producers, including BMW, has received $8.78 million from Germany to develop a "battery passport". The German government said the tool will trace the content and carbon footprint of batteries in Europe. This comes as from 2024, rechargeable EVs, light transport and industrial batteries sold in Europe might have to disclose their carbon footprint.

topic: Hackers steal NFTs worth $3 mn in Bored Ape club's Instagram hack
content: Hackers have stolen NFTs worth $3 million from owners after hacking into the Instagram account belonging to the Bored Ape Yacht Club collection. They uploaded a post that linked to a cloned version of BAYC's website and included a free crypto tokens offer. Hacked owners together lost four Bored Apes, six Mutant Apes and three Bored Ape Kennel Club NFTs.

topic: Billionaires like Musk play by different rules: US Senator on Twitter deal
content: US Senator Elizabeth Warren reacted to Elon Musk's $44 billion Twitter deal, saying, "Billionaires like Elon Musk play by a different set of rules than everyone else, accumulating power for their own gain." She also called the deal "dangerous for our democracy". "We need a wealth tax and strong rules to hold Big Tech accountable," Warren added.

topic: Meta appeals UK order to sell GIF-sharing platform GIPHY
content: Facebook-owner Meta has started its appeal against UK's Competition and Markets Authority's ruling that it must sell GIF-sharing platform GIPHY. It argued that its rival Snap offered far less to buy the platform which undermined the rationale used to block the deal. The CMA said it will defend its decision "vigorously". Meta acquired GIPHY in 2020 for $400 million.

topic: Ex-eBay exec pleads guilty to harassing US couple critical of eBay
content: James Baugh, eBay's former senior director of safety and security, has pleaded guilty to harassing a US couple, who ran a website critical of eBay, by arranging anonymous messages on Twitter and sending home deliveries that included a bloody pig mask and live insects. Baugh has pleaded guilty to nine counts including conspiracy, stalking through interstate travel and witness tampering.

topic: Morgan Stanley acting as Musk's lead adviser in $44 bn Twitter deal
content: Morgan Stanley is acting as Elon Musk's lead adviser in his $44 billion Twitter deal. Bank of America and Barclays have also advised him. At least nine other banks are reportedly helping Morgan Stanley, Bank of America and Barclays provide $25.5 billion in debt for the deal. Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase, and boutique investment bank Allen advised Twitter.

topic: Twitter user calls Musk's deal 'shameful', Dogecoin Co-creator reacts
content: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus liked a post on Twitter that called Elon Musk's Twitter deal "shameful" and said he could have given $1 million to every person in the world instead. "I know! Why didn't he fix all my specific problems exclusively instead of doing what he wanted with his own money," Markus said jokingly.

topic: Philips introduces ThermoProtect Straightener to prevent heat damage
content: Philips has introduced the new Philips ThermoProtect Hair Straightener equipped with SilkProCare+ ThermoProtect technology to distribute heat evenly across the plates. The brand revealed the keratin-infused ceramic plates come with multiple temperature settings to reduce up to 30% of hair damage. It provides smooth and frizz-free hair with vibrant shine, making it the right choice, it added

topic: India a technological powerhouse: EU chief on launching trade, tech body with India
content: India and the European Union (EU) have decided to launch a Trade and Technology Council to tackle challenges in trade, trusted technology and security. "We have India as a technological powerhouse," said EU chief Ursula von der Leyen while holding talks with PM Narendra Modi in Delhi. Till now, EU only had one such council in place with the US.

topic: Twitter in final stages of negotiation for its sale to Elon Musk: Report
content: Twitter is in the final stretch of negotiations with the world's richest person, Elon Musk, about a potential sale of the microblogging site, Bloomberg reported on Monday. "Twitter could reach an agreement as soon as Monday," Bloomberg added, without specifying the date. A few days ago, Musk had said that he had secured $46.5 billion in funding to buy Twitter.

topic: UPI server faces outage, users from across India complain of failed payments
content: The Unified Payments Interface (UPI) server appeared to be down for more than an hour on Sunday evening, causing disruptions in payments across India. Several users took to Twitter to complain about failed payments on major UPI apps, including PhonePe, Google Pay and Paytm. The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is yet to issue a statement on the outage.

topic: PM urges people to try 'Cashless Day Out' using only digital mode for payments
content: PM Narendra Modi has urged people to try a 'Cashless Day Out' by using only digital mode for payments. He gave an example of two girls from Delhi who spent an entire day roaming the city without doing any money transactions in cash. He said that people in small towns and in most villages are also transacting through UPI itself.

topic: Man killed in EV battery explosion in Vijayawada a day after buying e-scooter
content: A 40-year-old man died and three of his family members were left critically injured after an e-scooter's battery exploded inside their residence in Vijayawada. Siva Kumar had bought the Boom Motors Corbett 14 scooter on Friday and plugged its battery to charge before going to sleep, police said. Kumar died of burns and suffocation while being rushed to the hospital.

topic: Two-thirds of all Android smartphones sold in 2021 put user privacy at risk: Report
content: Check Point Research claimed two-thirds of all Android smartphones sold in 2021 put the privacy of users at risk. Check Point discovered vulnerabilities in the ALAC audio coding format that could've led an attacker to remotely get access to media and audio conversations. "MediaTek and Qualcomm, two of the largest mobile chipset manufacturers, used ALAC in their handsets," it added.

topic: Moving on from making fun of Bill Gates for shorting Tesla: Musk
content: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO, Elon Musk, on Sunday tweeted, "Moving on..." After several Twitter users began guessing that Musk is moving on from his desire to buy Twitter, Musk tweeted, "(from making fun of Gates for shorting Tesla while claiming to support climate change action)". Earlier, Musk admitted to confronting Bill Gates on shorting Tesla stock.

topic: Twitter begins deal talks with Elon Musk: Report
content: Twitter on Sunday began deal negotiations after Tesla CEO Elon Musk pursued many of the social media company's shareholders with financing details on his $43 billion acquisition offer, according to a Reuters report. Musk has said Twitter needs to be taken private to grow and become a genuine platform for free speech.

topic: Banks ask NPCI to clarify stance on UPI for crypto trading: Report
content: Several banks have asked the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) to issue a formal directive over restrictions regarding the use of United Payments Interface (UPI) to purchase and sell virtual digital assets, the Economic Times reported. Some banks have blocked UPI for crypto trading following "verbal instructions" from NPCI, the report said, adding a circular from NPCI is unlikely.

topic: Twitter executives met Musk to discuss $43 bn takeover bid: Reports
content: Twitter executives met the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday to discuss his $43 billion takeover offer, reports said. The development comes after Musk revealed that he has secured $46.5 billion in funding to take the social media company private. Musk has been meeting with Twitter shareholders recently to seek support for his bid, Reuters reported.

topic: Dogecoin payment sent over 160 km without using internet for the first time
content: A Dogecoin developer has successfully conducted the first Dogecoin payment without using the internet through a protocol called 'RadioDoge'. The developer tweeted that 4.2069 Dogecoin was sent over 160 km using libdogecoin, a programming library for creating Dogecoin projects, and radio. They added that the recipient used Starlink satellite network to relay the transfer to the Dogecoin mainnet.

topic: If you've worked on smart watches & phones, please join Neuralink: Musk
content: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "If you've engineered or manufactured smart watches or phones, please join Neuralink. Your skills are directly applicable." Co-founded by Musk in 2016, Neuralink is a neurotechnology company that is developing implantable brain-machine interfaces to help people with paralysis. In a recent interview, Musk suggested Neuralink could help treat morbid obesity.

topic: Billionaire Jack Dorsey drops his CEO title at Block, calls himself 'Block Head'
content: Twitter's billionaire Co-founder Jack Dorsey, who Co-founded fintech startup Block (previously Square), has changed his title of CEO at Block to 'Block Head and Chairperson'. "There will be no changes in Dorsey's roles and responsibilities," Block said in a regulatory filing. World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted to Dorsey, "Your new title at Block is...," followed by two fire emojis.

topic: Ola Electric recalls 1,441 two-wheelers amid incidents of EVs catching fire
content: Ola Electric is recalling 1,441 units of its electric two-wheelers in the wake of incidents of vehicles catching fire. The company said its investigation into the fire incident on March 26 in Pune is ongoing. Recently, there have been several incidents of electric two-wheelers catching fire in various parts of the country forcing manufacturers to recall their vehicles.

topic: Google adds 'reject all cookies' option in Europe after €150 mn fine
content: Google is introducing a single-click "reject all" option for cookies in Europe after France's data protection agency fined Google €150 million for confusing language in cookie banners. The option's rollout began from Google-owned YouTube in France and will soon be expanded across Europe on Google's search engine and YouTube. Cookies help websites keep track of a user's visits and activities.

topic: TCS could become the world's largest IT company: CEO
content: Tata Consultancy Services' (TCS) CEO Rajesh Gopinathan said, "Absolutely. In many ways, we already are," when he was asked if the Indian IT services major could become the world's largest IT company. Gopinathan also said, "Today we are $25 billion in size...There is no reason we shouldn't aspire to be double, triple, quadruple of the size we are today."

topic: Video shows Tesla car crashing into $3.5-million private jet in US
content: A video has surfaced online, showing a Tesla car crashing into a $3.5-million private jet in US' Washington. The car could be seen pushing the Cirrus Vision Jet across the tarmac. The Tesla owner was reportedly using the 'Smart Summon' feature that enables a Tesla vehicle to leave a parking space and navigate around obstacles to reach its owner.

topic: Twitter bans misleading ads contradicting climate change science
content: Twitter announced on Earth Day that it is banning misleading advertisements that go against the scientific consensus on climate change from its platform. "We believe that climate denialism shouldn't be monetised on Twitter," the micro-blogging site stated. The announcement, however, didn't indicate if the change would affect what users post on the micro-blogging site.

topic: India seeing digital transactions worth ₹20,000 cr daily: PM
content: PM Narendra Modi in his 'Mann Ki Baat' radio programme on Sunday said digital transactions worth ₹20,000 crore are now taking place daily in the country. "In March, UPI transactions even reached ₹10 lakh crore," PM Modi stated. He urged the public to go for 'Cashless Day Out', adding that digital transactions boost facilities and encourage honesty.

topic: Crypto is big part of future, people are looking at it the wrong way: Mark Cuban
content: Billionaire investor Mark Cuban told Bloomberg that cryptocurrencies are "a big part of the future", but "people are looking at it the wrong way". He explained, "They get really amped up about the price of cryptocurrencies, and...think that's really what crypto is. But that's the noise." Cuban said "the signal" is how crypto can help disrupt an industry.

topic: Indian oil firms saw 3.6 lakh cyberattacks in 6 months: Study
content: Indian oil companies faced 3.6 lakh cyberattacks between October 2021 and April 12, a study by civil society organisation CyberPeace Foundation revealed. One of the most recent and noticeable among these attacks was detected at Oil India Limited's (OIL) Assam headquarters this month, in which hackers reportedly demanded ₹57 crore. October saw the highest number of attacks at 1,17,633.

topic: Crypto profits grew 400% in 2021 to $162.7 bn: Chainalysis
content: Crypto investors gained a total of $162.7 billion in 2021, a 400% increase from just $32.5 billion in 2020, a report by data analytics firm Chainalysis revealed. As per the report, the US investors profited the most (around $47 billion), followed by the UK, Germany and China. India came 21st, with $1.85 billion in total realised gains, the report added.

topic: Apple's crypto rules raise potential antitrust issues: Coinbase CEO
content: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said Apple has banned a "bunch of features" on its mobile application which creates room for "potential antitrust issues". "Apple so far has not really played nice with crypto," Armstrong said. He added that he believes crypto-compatible phones could be "quite popular" in the future and that smartphone makers should start preparing crypto-specific hardware features.

topic: Hashtags don't really help posts get more views: Instagram chief
content: Adding hashtags to Instagram posts does not help in increasing the posts' views, the social media platform's chief Adam Mosseri said. Responding to an Instagram user when he was asked if "hashtags help views", Mosseri said, "I wouldn’t...think of hashtags as a way to...get more distribution." He added that hashtags help Instagram's algorithm in understanding what the post is about.

topic: Russia might mine Bitcoin amid sanctions to generate hard cash: IMF
content: Russia might sidestep Western sanctions by using its unwanted energy exports to mine Bitcoin to generate hard cash, IMF said in its recent Global Financial Stability Report. Russia could also use crypto exchanges that don't comply with the sanctions to carry out transactions, the report added. It urged countries to consider amending laws to take crypto assets into account.

topic: Bitcoin falls to six-week low, Ether declines nearly 5%
content: Bitcoin fell as much as 3.2% to $38,236 on Monday, marking the crypto's lowest level since March 15. The world's largest cryptocurrency extended this month's losses as investors shied away from risk assets amid a more hawkish outlook for US Federal Reserve policy tightening. Ether, the second-biggest crypto, also slumped 4.8% to $2,799, a level not seen since March 18.

topic: Musk rejects philanthropy talks with Bill Gates, pics of their chat surface
content: A purported chat between Elon Musk and Bill Gates has surfaced on social media. While Gates said he wanted to discuss "philanthropy possibilities" with Musk, the latter denied his request, citing Gates’ short position against Tesla. Musk tweeted that he didn't leak the chats and it wasn't a top secret that Gates had a half-a-billion short position against Tesla.

topic: Google to ban third-party call recording apps from Play Store from May 11
content: Google is set to introduce a new policy that will block third-party call recording apps from the Play Store from May 11. Such apps currently use the Accessibility API (designed for people with disabilities) to access the audio functions on Android devices. However, phones that come with an in-built call recording feature will still be able to use the function.

topic: My true moral error was creating Tesla & SpaceX at the same time: Elon Musk
content: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "My true moral error was creating Tesla and SpaceX at same time." He said that he avoided general management-related work at the electric vehicle maker Tesla and focused only on product and engineering. "Tried to have my cake and eat it too, which failed," Musk, who is currently the world's richest person, added.

topic: Apple asked to pay $1,000 to man for selling iPhone without charger in Brazil
content: A Brazilian court has ordered Apple to pay a compensation of about $1,000 to a customer who made a complaint about not getting a charger with his iPhone. The judge ruled that Apple is engaged in "abusive and illegal" practice by selling new iPhones without power adapters and that the latter is quite essential for the functioning of the iPhone.

topic: Taliban bans TikTok, PUBG for 'misleading youth' in Afghanistan
content:
The Taliban in Afghanistan has ordered a ban on TikTok and PUBG, saying that these platforms "mislead the younger generation". It said that it would also ban TV channels from airing 
 "immoral material". While it is unclear when the ban will come into place, this is the first time that the Taliban has banned an app since coming to power.

topic: Elon Musk registers 3 'X Holdings' companies to support his Twitter offer
content: Elon Musk has registered three holding companies in Delaware named 'X Holdings' to support his Twitter offer and to potentially bring all his business ventures under one parent company. In 2020, a Twitter user suggested Musk to form an 'X company' that would become the "parent company of Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink and Boring Company", to which Musk responded, "Good idea."

topic: Musk mocks Bill Gates with Apple's 'pregnant man' emoji, Twitter users react
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to mock Bill Gates with Apple's 'pregnant man' emoji that has been recently rolled out. Sharing a photo of Gates along with the emoji, Musk wrote, "In case you need to lose a boner fast." Reacting to his post, a user wrote, "Is this the guy people want to buy Twitter?"

topic: Man makes PowerPoint presentation for lost bag after Irish airline misplaces it
content: A passenger who was travelling to London after his wedding, placed AirTags in his different baggage in order to track their location. After having lost one bag, he repeatedly contacted the Irish carrier Aer Lingus for it and after not receiving any reply, he made a PowerPoint presentation showing where his bag had travelled to and shared it on Twitter.

topic: Time-lapse satellite pics of melting glaciers, deforestation shared by Google
content: To mark the Earth Day, Google Doodle has shared time-lapse satellite images showing melting glaciers, retreating snow cover, deforestation and coral bleaching. It is created from real imagery from Glacier retreat at the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro in Africa, Sermersooq Glacier retreat in  Greenland, Great Barrier Reef in Australia and Harz Forests in Germany.

topic: NASA has become an ATM machine to fuel Musk, Bezos' space race: Sanders
content: US Senator Bernie Sanders has expressed his concerns over NASA providing subsidies to private space companies like SpaceX and Blue Origin. He said, "NASA has become...an ATM machine to fuel a space race...between the two wealthiest men in America - Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos." Sanders added that space exploration can make the richest people in the world incredibly richer.

topic: Musk in talks with Thoma Bravo to partner on Twitter offer: Report
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is in talks with private equity firm Thoma Bravo for partnering on a possible takeover of Twitter, as per a New York Post report. It added that Thoma Bravo could be "the key" for Musk to move forward on his offer for Twitter. Musk said he has lined up $46.5 billion in financing to acquire Twitter.

topic: Florida finance head praises Musk's bid, criticises Twitter's strategy
content: Florida's finance department CFO Jimmy Patronis has praised Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion Twitter bid and said the state of Florida, which holds shares in Twitter, is "very concerned" about it leaving the offer. The poison pill strategy used by Twitter "hurts our state's equity position," Patronis added. He also called himself a "rabid Elon Musk fan".

topic: Ukraine postal service faces cyberattack amid Russian warship stamp sale
content: Ukraine's national postal service Ukrposhta was hit by a cyberattack after the sales of a postage stamp honouring 13 of its soldiers who told a Russian warship "go f*** yourself!" went online. Ukrposhta's Director-General Igor Smelyansky issued an apology to customers. "We are really doing everything...to restore both the online store and other Ukrposhta systems," he added.

topic: Tesla was a shell corp with no staff, no IP before I acquired it: Musk
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to GrowthSchool's Vaibhav Sisinty, who "reminded" users of Musk's Tesla acquisition, said, "It was a shell corp with no employees, no IP, no designs, no prototype, literally nothing." He added, if filing a shell corp constitutes 'founding a company', then he would be PayPal's only founder. Sisinty had highlighted that Musk isn't Tesla's founder.

topic: Ukraine Vice PM shares 'facepalm' emoji on Russia banning Zuckerberg
content: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov, on Twitter, shared a 'facepalm' emoji while saying that Russia had imposed sanctions on Mark Zuckerberg. Russia has banned 29 Americans, including Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, from entering Russia. Earlier, Russia had protested against Meta allowing users in some countries to call for violence against Russians and Russian soldiers over the Ukraine war.

topic: US official praises SpaceX for handling Russian jamming attack in Ukraine
content: Director of Electronic Warfare at Office of the Secretary of Defense Dave Tremper has said the way SpaceX Starlink handled Russia's jamming attacks in Ukraine was "eye-watering". Tremper said SpaceX fixed the attack a day after it was reported and suddenly the attack "was not effective" anymore. "We [US] need to be able to have that agility," Tremper said.

topic: Binance denies report of it agreeing to share user data with Russia
content: Binance has responded to a Reuters report which claimed it agreed to give users' data to Russian FSB-linked agency Rosfin, saying it's a false claim. "Inaccurate article by irresponsible journalists," Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said. The report had also said around the time Binance executive met Rosfin in 2021, Rosfin was seeking to trace Bitcoin funding of Kremlin-critic Alexey Navalny.

topic: SoftBank may retain controlling stake in UK's Arm post IPO: Report
content: Japan's SoftBank plans to keep a controlling stake in Arm after the UK-based firm's planned initial public offering, Bloomberg reported citing sources. It will sell only a small part of its stake in the IPO, with an aim to get higher valuations for the rest of the shares in future. Arm's IPO is expected to happen in 2023.

topic: US crypto-mining firm looks to sell gear worth $30 mn stuck in Russia
content: US-based cryptocurrency-mining firm Compass Mining is seeking to sell gear worth $30 million in Siberia after one of its rivals got sanctioned by the US over Russian operations. It's seeking to sell its mining equipment with 12 megawatts of capacity that can't be moved out of Russia. It will distribute the proceeds to about 2,000 clients that own the gear.

topic: Musk seeks to appeal finding that his 2018 Tesla tweets were false
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is seeking to appeal a US judge's finding that his 2018 tweets about taking Tesla private were false. In a filing, Musk's lawyers argued that the judge "parsed the individual phrases of the various tweets and indicated certain other information should have accompanied the tweets". They also highlighted that Twitter has a character limit per tweet.

topic: Twitter to pilot crypto payments for some users on platform
content: Twitter and Stripe will pilot cryptocurrency payments for select users of Twitter's Ticketed Spaces and Super Follows programmes. Eligible users will receive their earnings from Twitter in USD coin, a stablecoin backed by the US dollar. The crypto payments will be routed through Stripe Connect. Users will be able to hold their earnings in crypto wallets on the Polygon network.

topic: Social media's design is tilting us in the wrong direction: Obama
content: Former US President Barack Obama, while discussing social media platforms and disinformation at a conference, said, "The very design of these platforms is tilting us in the wrong direction." He warned that citizens no longer know "what to believe" due to false information spreading online. "Disinformation is a threat to our democracy," Obama said.

topic: Living up to our commitment: Binance on limiting services in Russia
content: World's largest cryptocurrency exchange Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao addressed the firm's decision to limit services in Russia, saying, "Binance gave its word...that we would implement any and all sanctions actions, and we are living up to that commitment." "We believe a crypto exchange should not have the power to unilaterally freeze an entire nation's user accounts," he added.

topic: US Republicans ask Twitter to retain records tied to Musk's offer
content: A group of 18 House Republicans in the US has asked Twitter board members to preserve all records and materials relating to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion offer. The members have been asked to preserve any message from official or personal accounts, including through encryption software. Their letter said Twitter's reactions to the offer are "concerning".

topic: Apple actively doing communist China's bidding: US FCC Commissioner
content: US FCC Commissioner Brendan Carr, while commenting on Apple CEO Tim Cook's speech discussing human rights, said, "Apple is actively doing the bidding of communist China." In a letter addressed to CEO Tim Cook, Carr accused Apple of censoring apps in China to please the government. "I would encourage Apple to evaluate its overall relationship with China," Carr added.

topic: Mark Zuckerberg only wants to talk about metaverse: Ex-Meta employee
content: A former Meta employee, who recently left the firm, has said metaverse is the "only thing" that CEO Mark Zuckerberg wants to talk about, Business Insider reported. Several current and former Meta employees said that his fixation with metaverse is becoming a point of frustration for employees. A current employee said the firm lacks a coherent strategy for metaverse.

topic: Starlink is our smart & quick solution to restore telecom: Ukraine
content: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov commented on internet connection's state in areas that Russia has left, adding that SpaceX's Starlink is Ukraine's "smart and quick solution to restore telecom". He said Russian soldiers are leaving behind "damaged infrastructure and broken internet connection". A Ukrainian telecom firm is using Starlink as a base station till optical cable gets fixed.

topic: Netflix shares crash over 35% in their biggest fall in more than 10 years
content: Netflix shares crashed over 35% on Wednesday in their biggest drop since October 2011. The stock crashed after Netflix reported losing 2,00,000 customers in Q1 2022, marking the first time in more than 10 years that the company lost subscribers. At the time of writing, Netflix shares were trading at $224.68, shedding over a third of their value.

topic: $54 billion wiped off Netflix's market value in its biggest drop since 2004
content: Netflix shares crashed 35% on Wednesday, wiping off $54 billion from the company's market value in its biggest drop since 2004. It made Netflix the worst-performing stock of the year on both S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 indexes. Netflix shares crashed after it reported losing 2,00,000 subscribers in Q1 2022, marking the first drop in subscribers in over 10 years.

topic: 'Non-compete' clause in offer letter won't limit career growth: Infosys after backlash
content: Infosys, facing backlash for its 'non-compete' clause in offer letters to the employees, on Wednesday said that it won't limit the employees' career growth. The agreement reportedly says that an employee shall not accept an employment offer from "named competitors" for six months after they quit Infosys. The company reportedly named TCS, Wipro, and other major IT firms as competitors.

topic: Russia bans entry of 29 Americans including Zuckerberg, US VP Kamala
content: Russia on Thursday banned 29 Americans from entering the Russian Federation "indefinitely". The Americans who were banned from entering Russia include Facebook Co-founder Mark Zuckerberg, US Vice President Kamala Harris, Deputy Defence Secretary Kathleen Hicks and Pentagon spokesperson John Kirby and other business leaders, officials and journalists. Russia also barred the entry of 61 Canadians.

topic: Elon Musk secures $46.5 billion in funding to buy Twitter
content: The world's richest person Elon Musk has said a $46.5 billion financing is lined up to acquire Twitter and he is considering starting a tender offer for its outstanding shares. Musk said Morgan Stanley and other financial institutions have committed around $25.5 billion in debt financing. "Almost $21 billion comes from Musk's own pocket through equity financing," Bloomberg reported.

topic: If Twitter bid succeeds, will defeat spam bots or die trying: Musk
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in a tweet said that if their Twitter acquisition offer succeeds, they will "defeat all spambots or die trying!" In another tweet posted on Friday he said, "And authenticate all real humans." Musk also said that he has lined up $46.5 billion in financing to acquire Twitter and is considering taking his offer directly to shareholders.

topic: Ackman sells $1.1 bn Netflix stock at $400 mn loss after shares fall 35%
content: Billionaire Bill Ackman has sold his entire stock worth $1.1 billion in Netflix at over $400 million loss three months after acquiring the position. Netflix shares crashed over 35% on Wednesday in their biggest drop since October 2011. "We have lost confidence in our ability to predict the company's future prospects with a sufficient degree of certainty," Ackman said.

topic: Sheryl Sandberg pressurised news site to drop stories about ex-boyfriend: Report
content: Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg twice pressurised the Daily Mail to abandon reporting damaging stories about her then-boyfriend, Activision CEO Bobby Kotick, as per a report. Sandberg reportedly contacted the Daily Mail in 2016 and 2019 as it worked on stories that revealed that one of Kotick’s former girlfriends had obtained a temporary restraining order against him in 2014.

topic: Musk confirms Tesla is working on robotaxi with no steering wheel or pedals
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, while presenting the company's Q1 2022 financial results, confirmed that Tesla is working on a robotaxi. "We're working on a new vehicle...which is a dedicated robotaxi that's highly optimised for autonomy, meaning it would not have [a] steering wheel or pedals," said Musk. "We aspire to reach volume production of that in 2024," added Musk.

topic: Consider working at Boring Company: Musk as his company raises $675 mn
content: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "Please consider working at The Boring Company! Our goal is to solve traffic, which plagues every major city on Earth." Musk tweeted this after his company, which builds tunnels for vehicles to avoid traffic, raised $675 million in funding at a $5.675 billion valuation. "Purpose is to recruit amazing people," The Boring Company tweeted.

topic: I don't take my phones to meetings to avoid being spied on: EU tech chief
content: The EU's technology chief Margrethe Vestager advised not to take phones to important meetings to avoid digital espionage. "I'd leave my phones and my iPad outside of the room before entering," she said. "Most of my feed is so boring that even if you had access to it, you'd think oh my God, this woman...she has no life," she added.

topic: BMW unveils new all-electric i7 with 'private cinema screen' in the back seat
content: German carmaker BMW has unveiled its all-electric 2023 BMW i7 sedan. It features what BMW is calling a 'Theatre Screen', a 31.3-inch panoramic display in 32:9 format with 8K resolution which extends downwards from the roof. "The screen transforms the second row of seats into an exclusive private cinema on wheels," BMW said.

topic: Instagram to downrank TikTok reposts, promote native content
content: Instagram Head Adam Mosseri has announced the company's plan to downrank Reels videos that are not original to the platform. This means all the reshared content from apps like TikTok will soon be shown less to promote original content. "If you create something from scratch, you should get more credit than if you're resharing something," Mosseri stated.

topic: Elon Musk's Boring Company raises $675 mn at $6 bn valuation
content: World's richest person Elon Musk-led The Boring Company has raised $675 million in a funding round led by Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital. The round has valued the startup at nearly $6 billion. The funding also saw participation from Valor Equity Partners, Founders Fund, 8VC, Craft Ventures, and DFJ Growth. The startup had last raised $120 million three years ago.

topic: Tesla robot to be worth more than its self-driving business: Musk
content: World's richest person and Tesla CEO, Elon Musk, said the company's robot Optimus would eventually be worth more than its full self-driving (FSD) business. "I was surprised that people didn't realise the magnitude of the Optimus robot program," Musk stated during Wednesday's earnings call. Optimus, a 5'8" humanoid robot, was first introduced in August 2021 during Tesla's inaugural AI Day.

topic: Amazon acquires B'luru-based social commerce startup GlowRoad
content: Amazon has acquired Bengaluru-based social commerce startup GlowRoad in an all-cash deal. GlowRoad, which is backed by venture capital fund Accel, Vertex Ventures, among others, was reportedly last valued at around $75 million. Post the deal, GlowRoad's team of around 170 employees will join Amazon and it will continue to be run as an independent unit for now.

topic: Not sure how it got through review: Binance on its swastika-like emoji
content: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance took to Twitter to react to the issue surrounding an emoji it unveiled earlier, saying, "Well that was...really embarrassing. We're not sure how that emoji got through...layers of review without anyone noticing." Several users had pointed out the emoji's resemblance to swastika symbol used by Nazis. "We immediately flagged the issue, pulled it down," Binance added.

topic: 4 US Amazon drivers sue firm over being stuck in warehouse amid tornado
content: Four US Amazon drivers have sued the firm after they sustained injuries while they were stuck in a warehouse amid a tornado in December. Amazon allegedly threatened to fire employees who tried to leave the facility and seek shelter at home. A separate lawsuit was filed on behalf of the mother of deceased worker DeAndre Morrow.

topic: Apple store workers in Atlanta file for firm's 1st US union election
content: Workers at an Apple store in Atlanta have filed for a union election with the NLRB. If a majority of the workers vote to unionise, the store would be the first unionised US Apple store. "We want to make sure...every Apple worker is able to afford quality housing and basic living expenses," an Apple worker said.

topic: Largest crypto exchange Binance limits services in Russia
content: World's largest crypto exchange Binance is limiting services for Russian nationals or entities that have crypto assets exceeding €10,000, following the EU's latest sanctions against Russia. Russian nationals or legal entities in Russia who have crypto account balances that exceed €10,000 will be given 90 days to close their positions. Affected accounts will be put into a withdrawal-only mode.

topic: WhatsApp planning paid multi-device support for businesses: Report
content: WhatsApp is working on a paid subscription plan for WhatsApp Business, which will allow users to connect up to 10 devices to a single WhatsApp account, WaBetaInfo reported. This will allow multiple employees to access the same account on their phones. Currently, users can connect four additional devices for free, both on WhatsApp and WhatsApp Business.

topic: Tesla reports $3.32 bn profit in Q1, 658% rise year-on-year
content: Tesla has reported a $3.32 billion profit in the first quarter of 2022, a 658% increase from the $438 million reported in the same period last year. Its revenue for the quarter stood at  $18.76 billion, beating estimates of $17.85 billion. Tesla's revenue saw an 81% increase year-over-year, compared to $10.4 billion in revenue in Q1 2021.

topic: US judge rejects 'gag order' for Musk in 2018 Tesla tweets case
content: A US judge has ruled Tesla CEO Elon Musk will not be subjected to a "gag order" in a lawsuit against his 2018 tweets on taking Tesla private. He said no proof was found that letting Musk talk posed a danger to a trial. Shareholders had asked for the order after Musk recently discussed the case at a TED conference.

topic: EU panel backs proposal for common worldwide phone charger port
content: A European Parliament committee on Wednesday backed a proposal suggesting the adoption of a common charging port for a range of mobile gadgetry including phones, tablets, low-powered laptops and headphones. Chargers for portable devices shipped to Europe generate 11,000 to 13,000 tonnes of e-waste every year, a Parliamentarian said. An assembly vote over the proposal will take place next month.

topic: Adani JV among 14 firms chosen under ₹120 crore-drone PLI scheme
content: Fourteen drone companies, including Adani's joint venture company with Israel's Elbit, and ideaForge Technology, have been selected as beneficiaries of a production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme, the Aviation Ministry stated. The PLI, worth ₹120 crore, is aimed at boosting drone manufacturing in India. The firms will be given 20% of the "value addition" made by them in the next three years.

topic: Musk's Starlink signs 1st deal to provide in-flight WiFi
content: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX has signed its first deal with an air carrier to provide in-flight WiFi using the Starlink satellite network. As part of the deal, signed with semi-private jet service JSX, 100 aeroplanes will be equipped with Starlink terminals. The first flight having the terminal is expected to fly by the end of this year.

topic: Netflix loses subscribers for 1st time in more than 10 years
content: The number of Netflix subscribers has fallen for the first time in more than a decade. The streaming company lost 200,000 members in the first three months of the year, the company said on Tuesday. Netflix's shares, already down more than 40% this year, tumbled as much as 27% to $256 in after-hours trading.

topic: UK judge orders extradition of Assange to US; will face 175-year sentence
content: A UK judge has ordered the extradition of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to the US where he will face a 175-year sentence. Assange is wanted in the US on 18 criminal charges after WikiLeaks published thousands of classified files and diplomatic cables in 2010. The decision will now move to UK Home Secretary Priti Patel.

topic: What reasons did Netflix give for losing members for the first time in 10 years?
content: Netflix revealed that 2,00,000 people left the streaming service in the first three months of the year, marking its first fall in subscribers in more than 10 years. Netflix gave several reasons including COVID-19 disruptions, account sharing, sluggish economic growth, increasing inflation, and Russia's invasion of Ukraine for slower growth. It also cited competition from YouTube, Amazon, and Hulu.

topic: Russian forces steal Ukraine man's AirPods, he uses them to track their movement
content: A Ukrainian man has been tracking the redeployment of Russia forces via AirPods stolen from him by invading troops. Vitaliy Semenets' AirPods were looted from his home in Hostomel, near Kyiv, soon after the war began as Russia tried to take the Ukrainian capital. He has since been using Find My app to track the movement of Russian forces.

topic: Elon Musk willing to invest up to $15 billion of own money to buy Twitter: Report
content: Elon Musk is willing to invest between $10 billion and $15 billion of his own money to take Twitter Inc private, the New York Post reported citing two sources. The Tesla CEO and world's richest man, who is Twitter's second-biggest shareholder with a 9.1% stake, is planning to launch an offer in about 10 days, the report added.

topic: Woke mind virus making Netflix unwatchable: Musk as Netflix loses members
content: The world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "The woke mind virus is making Netflix unwatchable." The tweet came after Netflix reported losing subscribers for the first time in more than 10 years. When a Twitter user said, "Not just Netflix. Movies in general, videogames, TV, they're all infested with current year trend woke garbage," Musk responded, "True".

topic: Blackstone, Vista rule out financing Musk's $43 bn Twitter bid: Report
content: Private equity firms Blackstone and Vista Equity Partners have ruled out financing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid to buy Twitter, Bloomberg reported. Brookfield Asset Management has also decided not to finance the bid. Blackstone and Vista have decided not to finance any potential bid for Twitter, even if it's from another party besides Musk, at the moment.

topic: Nothing to say: Ex-Twitter CEO on why he didn't do anything about 'dysfunctional' board
content: After former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey tweeted that their board has "consistently been the dysfunction" of the company, a US journalist argued why he hadn't done anything about it when he ran the firm. Replying to him, Dorsey tweeted, "So much to say…but nothing that can be said." Dorsey's remarks come amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter.

topic: Musk leaves a blank space in his latest tweet, users link it to buying Twitter
content: Elon Musk tweeted, "_______ is the Night," which Twitter users and reports linked to his plan of buying Twitter. It fuelled speculations that he'd launch a tender offer for Twitter shares if the board resists his proposal to acquire Twitter. "The missing word may be 'Tender' as per the F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel, or it could be 'Tonight'," Bloomberg reported.

topic: Electric chopsticks that can make food taste saltier developed in Japan
content: Researchers in Japan claim that they have developed computerised chopsticks that can make food taste saltier, in a "world first". Co-developed by Meiji University professor Homei Miyashita and beverage maker Kirin Holdings, the device uses electrical stimulation and is attached to a mini wristband computer. The chopsticks can potentially help people reduce their salt intake, the researchers said.

topic: Ukrainian soldier escapes death as his phone stops bullet fired by Russians
content: A purported video has surfaced on social media that showed a Ukrainian soldier pulling out a smartphone from his pocket that had a bullet lodged inside it. The soldier had a narrow escape from death as the clip showed the smartphone with a 7.2 mm bullet, that was fired by the Russian troops at him, peeking from its one end.

topic: Instagram rolls out product tagging for public account users in US
content: Instagram has enabled tagging products in feed posts for all public account users in the US. In a blog post, Instagram explained how the feature would work and said that the idea behind this is to support small businesses and help them get traction. The platform also said they are working on ways for users to tag products in Stories.

topic: Xbox head of research & design quits Microsoft after nearly 20 yrs
content: Xbox's head of research and design Chris Novak has announced that he is leaving Microsoft after nearly 20 years. In his latest role, Novak led the user experience for things like Xbox Game Pass, Xbox Cloud Gaming, and Xbox Live, according to his LinkedIn. At Microsoft, he also held the roles of Design Architect and Design Director.

topic: Will hold Twitter board accountable over Musk's bid rejection: US governor
content: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has said the state will seek ways to hold Twitter's board "accountable" over the rejection of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid to buy the platform. The state will hold the board "accountable for breaching their fiduciary duty", he said. "They rejected it because they know that they can't control Elon Musk," DeSantis said.

topic: Starlink helped restore 10 km of cable connection between villages: Ukraine
content: Ukrainian Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has said SpaceX's Starlink helped restore 10 kilometres of cable connection between villages quickly in the Chernihiv region. "It wouldn't be possible to restore 10 km of...connection between villages...after serious battles so quick. Normally it takes few months," he added. Baryshivka-Net resumed the network for five villages with one Starlink.

topic: Jio loses mobile subscribers for 3rd straight month; Airtel gains
content: Reliance Jio lost 36.6 lakh mobile subscribers in February, the first time that it has lost subscribers for the third consecutive month, data by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) showed. Meanwhile, Bharti Airtel, the only telco to gain subscribers in February, added 15.91 lakh new customers. Vodafone Idea lost 15.32 lakh users while BSNL lost 1.11 lakh customers.

topic: Apple products had 20% recycled materials in 2021, highest-ever
content: Apple has revealed that nearly 20% of all material used in Apple products in 2021 was recycled, the highest-ever use of recycled content. For the first time ever for any Apple product, Apple used recycled gold in the main logic board in the iPhone 13 and iPhone13 Pro. Apple products in 2021 included 45% certified recycled rare earth elements.

topic: Sounds high: Musk on Meta spending $26.8 mn on Zuckerberg's security
content: World's richest person Elon Musk in response to a story on Meta spending $26.8 million on CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021 said, "Sounds high." The figure was reportedly 6% higher than $25.3 million spent in 2020. Private travel and costs associated with security protocols due to the COVID-19 were cited as reasons for such costs in 2021.

topic: DFEH rushed to sue us for quick publicity grab: Tesla on racism suit
content: Tesla has accused the US' DFEH of abandoning its founding purpose, ignoring its statutory obligations and rushing to sue it "perhaps for a quick publicity grab". The agency had alleged Tesla ignored years of complaints about racial slurs in its California factory. Tesla also said the DFEH perhaps feared that US' EEOC would be the first to settle with Tesla.

topic: YouTube blocks HK's sole leadership candidate under US sanctions
content: YouTube has blocked the account of Hong Kong's sole leadership candidate John Lee as part of US sanctions. "With regards to some [social] media [platforms] which I will have no access to, I feel disappointed but this will not affect my election effort," Lee said. Meta said it had taken steps to prevent the use of payments services by Lee.

topic: LinkedIn most imitated brand for phishing in Q1 2022: Check Point
content: As per a report by Check Point Research (CPR), LinkedIn, for the first time ever, has become the most often imitated brand by cyber criminals for phishing. CPR stated that LinkedIn accounted for 52% of all phishing attempts during Q1 2022. It was followed by DHL (14%), Google (7%), Microsoft (6%), FedEx (6%), WhatsApp (4%) and Amazon (2%).

topic: Ethereum network has many single points of failure: Twitter's Dorsey
content: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey in his response to a tweet stated that the Ethereum network "has many single points of failure" and the projects built on it are "not interesting" to him. This comes after Ethereum Co-founder, Vitalik Buterin, commented on Elon Musk's Twitter bid saying he opposes wealthy people or organisations' "hostile" take over of social media firms.

topic: Netflix may offer cheaper ad-supported plans amid subscriber loss
content: Netflix is thinking about offering a lower-priced version of the service with advertising amid a fall in the number of subscribers for the first time in over a decade. Netflix CEO Reed Hastings said that even though he's been "against the complexity of advertising", he's a "bigger fan of consumer choice". Netflix lost 2,00,000 subscribers in Q1 2022.

topic: Ex-eBay exec to plead guilty to cyberstalking campaign against couple
content: James Baugh, eBay's former senior director of safety and security, will plead guilty to running a 2019 cyberstalking campaign against a couple who ran a website critical of eBay. Baugh is one of seven former eBay workers charged with harassing the couple behind the newsletter EcommerceBytes. Baugh's lawyers had requested a hearing for him to plead guilty on April 25.

topic: Aus scientists to power Tesla on 15,000-km trip with printed solar panels
content: Australian scientists will test using printed solar panels to run a Tesla on a 15,100-kilometre journey beginning in September. The team will use 18 of its printed plastic solar panels, each 18 metres (59 feet) long. They will roll out the panels beside the car to absorb sunlight when the car will be in need of a charge.

topic: Seemed wasteful: Musk on Tesla removing mobile connectors with cars
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk defended the firm's decision to stop including its mobile connector with new car purchases, saying, "Usage statistics were super low, so seemed wasteful." Tesla will instead sell its charging kit separately for a lower $200 price. Musk added Tesla will "make it easy" to order the mobile connector when purchasing a car.

topic: India to use semiconductors of $80 bn to make items worth $300 bn: Govt
content: Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar has said India will consume semiconductors of about $70-80 billion to manufacture electronics products worth $300 billion by 2026. Of the target of $300 billion in electronic manufacturing, $120 billion is being aimed for export. PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first 'Semicon India 2022 Conference' in Bengaluru.
